KjopEZXU2_B37pKcjdiaAA.text: If you are vegan and enjoy eating vegan tacos, then you would certainly enjoy eating at Panchos Vegan tacos.  Panchos Vegan Tacos is located on the East side of Las Vegas inside the Tropicana Plaza. This taco joint does not only have tacos, but it has a variety of mexican food such as sopes, nachos, burritos etc; and they're all vegan. Panchos is a vegan restaurant that just opened up in the middle of 2017 and has been getting more popular as the population of vegan/ vegetarians has been growing overall too.     Having vegan family members can make eating out hard to do, because there is not a lot of vegan options in Las Vegas. I have come across a bunch of vegan places which have only been burger joints. I am vegetarian so my options of eating out is not as difficult as it is for my mother.  There is currently only one Panchos Vegan Tacos in Las Vegas as it a little brand new. Panchos Vegan Tacos is like a Robertos but everything on their menus is all vegan. Their tacos are filled with vegan ground meat and topped with cilantro, pico de gallo, and green spicy salsa. Their sopes are also topped off with vegan meat, chopped lettuce and tomatoes and a vegan cream.      I came across this place on Mother's Day. On a special day like this I did not want to take my mother to eat at the same burger joint she always goes to. So when we came across Panchos Vegan Tacos we thought it would be gross because the menus online did not look satisfying and the photos that were posted did not look as great either. When arriving, the restaurant was packed, and the place looked very unorganized, they used one whole section of the restaurant for the employees and guest to order their food, and the other half of the restaurant had about 8 booths and 4 tables. This restaurant does feel crowded because you have the line of guests ordering and then the other half of the line is outside or in the dining room area.   Although I had a first bad impression of this place, the employee greeted us and we told her that we were new to this place. Once we informed her of being new she explained the entire menu to us making things easier for us to explore the menu. Their food certainly surprised me and I was very surprised on how similar the street tacos from Panchos Vegan Tacos tasted like real street tacos.  My mother certainly enjoyed coming here as she told me how great the street tacos were too and how the sopes tasted just like the sopes she makes at home. This place does not only bring you great quality of food but it can also bring you back to home, because the foods have similar tastings to the original dishes.  The pricing for each plate is very affordable and the highest I have seen on the menu was about ten dollars, and that was for a huge burrito. Eating out at a vegan restaurant can turn out to be very expensive because there is not a lot to begin with, making prices higher since it is a unique thing to have in the city . So far this place is great and affordable and you can take someone out to eat here for just about any event. One thing that I loved about this restaurant is how pet friendly they are. I know that some people are not comfortable with having pets in the space that they are eating at, but this place surprised me because not only did the employees not mind but the guest at that time eating there did not mind also. This explains how good the environment here is and the atmosphere.Another thing I loved was the great service they provide, the employees did not mind taking the time to explain the entire menu to us and tell us how their dishes were done, I believe that's what helped us pick our dish because it gave us details of what we were going to be expecting. I recommend anyone who loves street tacos and mexican food overall to come visit Panchos Vegan Tacos.  I was satisfied with this place and have already told others to come here and have received great feedback. A couple of feedbacks I have received were from people who were not vegan/ vegetarian and have told me that the food that they tried tasted better than a taco with real meat. I have also received feedback from someone who was encouraged to stop eating meat because it made her realize that she can still eat her favorite foods with no meats. I have received a lot of positive feedback about the dishes and feedback about encouraging some people to try out the vegan/ vegetarian lifestyle. I think it is amazing that a simple review like minds can change another person's mindset in the up most positive ways. My intentions of sharing this place with others was not to encourage others to go vegan but to tell those who are vegan/ vegetarian to try this mexican joint out.

If you modify your order at all make sure you double check because they commonly mess up modifications. I always order either no sour cream or order it on the side and maybe 30% of the time it's still on top. Management and owner are very helpful though and will make it right if there are any issues.   When ordering delivery through a 3rd party (Postmates, Uber Eats, Amazon) each service lists the menu items differently, and there are a few minor price discrepancies between them as well. I'd recommend they review their menus on each am make them consistent, especially when it comes to listing items such as fillings properly.  Creating some promo codes for these apps would be useful as well.  Overall good food and kind staff. So glad for a vegan Mexican restaurant!

ot05uW-OmAN7liM-46lyHQ.text: Didn't get five stars because they were out of several things, one of them being the main thing we went there for... potato tacos.   + Tasty Vegan Mexican food, even my non-vegan sister loved it. + Tostadas were my absolute favorite thing + They were super busy, which is good and the guy who took our order was super friendly and helpful.  + Wait time was minimal   - They were out of a the potato tacos, booo - Not a ton of seating inside  Quickies: * The red sauce is HOT * Order potato tacos, everyone I know raves about them * Mushroom option tasted way better than any fake meat option IMO  This is my new go-to Mexican food spot for sure. hF0R7n04y8YKDZ8bXP7oQg.text: FOOD: All Vegan, all Mexican, all the time! They make their sauces (including a sour cream and fresh salsas) in house. The potato taquitos dorados are a good option for Vegan newbies, or their tacos. The "asada" is pretty good, will be trying the "al pastor" next. I was hoping to get a great grilled veggie burrito or even some veggie fajitas, but they don't seem to do that, which I found strange. I was thrilled to see quesadillas and nachos on the menu, but my "asada" quesadilla barely had anything in it. Vegan cheese can be a difficult transition though. Avocado was fresh but I'm perplexed as to why they only seem to have chopped iceberg lettuce and underripe tomatoes when their target audience is people who eat produce for half of their diet. Menu is extensive though, with other options including tamales, tortas, fideo soup, and sopes.  SERVICE: Not impressed with the female cashier. It's not obvious that you walk up to the bar to order since the register is smack-dab in the middle of the bar with chairs around it and tables blocking any reasonable area where patrons would line up. There's no signage and the menus are all over the tables, but there is no table service. Finally figured it out on my own since no one addressed me after I entered and stood around for a few minutes. Placed my order and the cashier had to double check with the kitchen for availability of every item, then asks multiple times if it's for here or to-go, making it an unnecessarily long process. No smiles, no friendliness, nothing that indicates she understands she's in a service position or representing a new business. Male staff was the exact opposite: friendly, engaging, knowledgeable, and helpful, even brought me out extra salsa.  LOCATION: Parking lot is small, which may be a problem as they get more popular. Interior is a ghastly orange color, no decor to speak of, and the microwave is right in plain sight of the customers. Random bottles of generic salsa are out on counter.  Would suggest moving the microwave and adding a salsa bar to improve the interior.  This is a neighborhood with several solid Mexican restaurants, I'd only pick this place if you're specifically wanting dishes with vegan cheese/meat options as there are better veggie burritos nearby.  UPDATE 8/2018: I've been in a few more times. They've remodeled. The space has slightly improved but the service and food are still hit or miss to me. My food never comes out looking the way their social media photos do, and though the portions are large and prices are fair, the food itself just isn't as flavorful as other similar spots around town.

vNezBM3MaBcC3Zw4lOicVA.text: I can barely take it anymore. Pancho's used to be my all time favorite vegan spot in Vegas. I'd order something every day or every other day. The food in my opinion is really good, but at times they really just screw you over. Recently I've been ordering through Postmates to save myself the trip and 20-30 minutes wait sitting inside of the restaurant (they're really slow). Every.single.time with the past, I don't know 10+ orders they managed to screw things up. Usually I'll pardon simple mistakes, but with how frequent it is, I just can't. They've left out items from my order, added toppings to burgers, tacos, etc that I specifically asked them to leave out, not added toppings to items that I paid extra for.. I order the Beyond Burger frequently, asking them to add bacon and jalapenos..it's gotten to the point where I buy my own vegan bacon and some jalapenos to add myself because I know they won't add them. On a past order, I wrote in the "special request" box on Postmates that they didn't add the toppings I paid for last time, and would like them this time. They gave me the toppings but STILL charged me. I've called a few times to complain and not once have they given me an apology. They're usually just like "oh..uh you can contact Postmates support and get a refund. We can't do anything" or something similar to that. With the amount of food I've paid for and not received, I'd have enough money to get a couple meals there for free. It's just ridiculous. Time to find a new vegan taco shop :(

The potato tacos was crispy on the outside and soft fluffy potato inside. The taste was more than I expected. The rice and beans were even delicious.   The Posole I added "chorizo" the flavor was good by itself but better once I dressed it with limes, radish, cilantro and onions.   The tacos was exceptional. Full of flavor.   I would definitely recommend this restaurant to all my vegan friends. Good Job Pancho's!!

lFuBqdsjikBcGxiAX8gQSQ.text: 12/12/18 I strongly believe in "that if you don't have nothing nice to say, then don't say nothing at all..." but when the food & service make you download yelp, create a profile, just to vent?! I find that very poor all around...   I've given to many "benefit of doubts" on how they could screw up a simple order, cold food, old food, tasteless food, maybe I explained it wrong? Maybe they're short staffed, maybe it's just one of those days? but I can't do that anymore, not at my families expense and not at my expense...   I want to be in love with Pancho's as I once was, I don't know what the change in vibe/crew was but it's obvious, ands it's definitely obvious in the food. Ive had breakfast, lunch, and dinner here, numerous times and I can no longer excuse my insanity, cause I keep coming over and over expecting a different result. But SIGH  I do not think I'll be back, at least for awhile, and by awhile I mean like a year.   Breakfast I was burping up ALL DAY. How is a breakfast burrito soupy? Why is my concha harder than a rock (swapped it out for a cookie, I didn't want it to, but i figured, better than a refund,THAN 5mins later they load fresh conchas?). Coffee refill a dollar? Get out of here...  Lunch and dinner, you better pray to vegan Jesus that it's not busy. Cause they don't do special orders, I mean it's best just not to do special orders. We've (we, being my family and I) have gotten our foods at different times,(not all served at once) cold food and OLD FOOD, buns, you know when it falls apart it's old. Not falls apart because it's big, I mean it crumbles...  As I said earlier I want to love Pancho's, but it's to much of a risk, yes this is Vegas, but not exactly the place I thought I'd have to gamble for my food...  Ps. I know store bought gauc when I taste it. Also  S M I L E  it does help, i never really seen any employee smile here? And maybe during busy hours put a senior staff on register, I'm not downing trainees. But at least some kind of support, "I don't know" is never a good answer (we need knowledge)... please consider a salamander grill some kind of heat lamp? But is that even an answer?   Making this review broke my heart, And I would not recommend this place to anyone. Pancho's was my "go to" spot when breaking into Veganism (1 year strong) and now it's crushing to look else where...  On a positive note, I now believe it's given me enough confidence in myself that I can do better for myself and family at home...  I believe in the vegan community, and I only want to see vegan options uplifted, but this place has changed and not for the better...

I tooooooooooooore it up, it was just the right amount of spicy and well I'm glad this place is not far from my job, I will most def be coming back soon!! Thank you for the awesome service as well, the only thing I didn't like was that couple in front of us ordering, next time please don't take 10 minutes to sit and look at the menu deciding what the fuck you want, while you're ordering, Some of us are hungry!! Zac kept it classy though, he answered all their questions (which they many). I will see this place soon.

gSpdtXpp6ZOng1XPtmVE8g.text: I'm new to vegan food so I don't have know whats excellent and not:)  I really like this place. I've been there 3 times so far. They are extremely nice and you get all walks of life. You place your order at the register and sit where ever you'd like while waiting for your food.The place is very clean. You can either eat there or take out. I assume it's a step above fast food  I've had the enchilada, torta, fries, nachos, potato taco, rice and beans so far. The fries with chorizo is my favorite so far. Second is the nachos with chick-end( I like there cheese sauce for it).Not a fan of he Daiya shredded cheese though.    Overall I like it and will keep going back :)

4P05KjJcGbeZQ9h_Cmitbg.text: I am addicted to The tamales !!!!! They are so incredibly delicious it's ridiculous!!! Portions are huge here as well and definitely get your money worth!!

6la1ClUrUFRaIr0ai05XFA.text: Jesus Christ I want to like this place so bad! I keep coming back here trying to have a better experience but every single time I've ever been here they've messed something up.   First of all let's address the elephant in the room. What is going on with the AC?! There is none! They told me "yeah unfortunately the owner of the building won't fix it". Then it sounds like it's time to find a new owner of a new building. I've literally ordered no onions every single time I've been here and every single time except for the last time they gave me onions. That doesn't mean they didn't mess up though. Wouldn't be Panchos without a screw up. I waited for damn near a half hour for some tacos to go!   It just really bums me out. I've been to this restaurant four times now and this is my final time. The restaurant area looks very bad. The no AC just makes it even worse. They could at least paint the wall one color. It's a combination of multiple oranges where they painted over other things with the wrong color. The bathroom is the cleanest thing I've seen in this establishment and it's extremely clean.  I wish the rest of the restaurant reflected what the bathroom does which is typically the opposite of anywhere you go.  Such a great concept but what a crappy location and store in general.  The food is pretty good here but it's everything else that brings down the place. I figured maybe if I ordered to go this time I would be satisfied but no yet again it's something.

JFru4bsyFn1CnfogMTk1wQ.text: Absolutely delicious !!!  Every thing in the delivery bag was amazing !!  Everything ! The salsa's green & red were fresh & delicious, the cheese on top of the tacos I really liked too ( idk what kind it was but really liked) my potatoes were seasoned nicely and the crunchy taco was fresh !   Love love pleasantly surprised that every item was satisfying to me & my non vegan mom!!

D-asKtzAOh_bIMXVcdJg1A.text: So delicious. Got the spicy ranchero fries and al pastor tacos which were both so good, excellent potions too, we couldn't even finish the fries between two days.

yFy_7zwo0xrQai5st306zg.text: I had to sit back and realize this restaurant deserved an update on my previous review.   I continue to stand tall about exploring more kid menu options that make sense. It's difficult to get younger children to maintain the plant based eating habits. You have an opportunity to truly craft a solution that is much needed in this town, and in my favorite type of food, Mexican.   Taking this need and owning it could go a long way! It's also not advantageous as a parent to order the quesadilla and it be over $7.   I wanted to just get that tidbit out of the way so I can reinforce that aside from the suggestion - this restaurant still receives top marks.   The enchiladas are amazing, sopes and posole - just the way I remember, as well as street tacos and other popular favorites!   You get red or green sauce, or when you takeout - both, and it's phenomenal. I took advantage of the $1 Vegan donuts and yea, just had to. So delicious.   Panchos has become a frequent choice in my house and I'm always excited to try new dishes on their menu. The have taco Tuesday and follow their Facebook page for the occasional special offers or new meals!

1D4Q0EJw9vdya9p1KIcCdw.text: 5 stars all the way to this place because we could not stop eating here when we were visiting. We came here 3 days in a row and could not stop everytime.   Each time i went i got the cuban torta and oh my god cannot even explain how bomb is was. We also got the al pastor tacos and T H A T  M E A T  I S  T O  D I E  F O R. They put pineapple in it and it has to be one of the most perfect blends. We also got the arroz con leche and was hoping for that to be warm but nevertheless was still really good.   So good that we have to take food for the drive back home and food for when we got home cause it was that good. We got the same cuban torta and al pastor tacos and a chocolate cake and that chocolate cake was one of the best chocolate cakes i have ever had in my life no joke.

Gzyo3X6WPunpQ74oOt50zA.text: My favorite restaurant in Vegas, hands down. Delicious, cheap, friendly, and a huge variety of all the foods I've missed since going veg. Recommend anything and everything, but what really wowed me were the sopes and the pan dulce.

OEDk7AknIYIsdTyvGGJDEA.text: Any bad review sounds like someone comparing it to a 5 star restaurant in the cosmo.....this place is a thriving and phenomenal establishment with the friendliest people and the best tasting vegan food in Vegas. Wait times can get somewhat long but the staff keeps you updated as much as possible and, honestly, why are you going out to eat if you're in THAT much of a rush? Also, they're a small business just starting out, you have to forgive if they're out of certain products-at least they let you know right off the bat instead of keeping you guessing. If I could donate a million dollars to any restaurant it would be this place. I can't get over how delicious and authentic the food tastes and how FRIENDLY!!! The staff is. I love this place so much, and I'm so glad they're expanding. Definitely make this place a regular one.

g1KKm4qRdp0MvBa_hhfr1g.text: I really, really wanted to love this place because I never have Mexican food. However, while the service was great, and there were so many choices, my "cheese" enchiladas weren't melted. It's almost as if I made them myself, and I never want to pay for food I can make myself.

Gxt3UNKJ0eYh9UT5ksQ9iA.text: This was 5 Stars. I'm not even vegan and I'd prefer this place over a regular taco place. Everyone was super accommodating and friendly. The food was fresh and delicious. I'd recommend to anyone.

Ms0QG5whkCYeCWbSi6a5Yw.text: 07/10/17 DINNER  Not good.  Hubby and I semi-vegan for a while. Tried many soy and gluten meat substitutes, never liked any except firm tofu. Hubby is amazing cook, uses tofu WELL in home cooking. He'd chef a great vegan restaurant if given the chance. Recently became full-time vegans for 5 months in prep for vacation. Only began playing with dairy substitutes at home, having good luck finding palatable ones.  Went to Pancho's with friend who had liked it his few previous visits.  Woman taking order at counter (walk in, order at counter, brought food to table) initially unfriendly and distracted, got her in better mood after a while. Paid with credit card, later discovered never given receipt, so can't confirm if 10% discounted, sign at counter states "Meatless Monday" 10% off. Ordered a lot of food because friend recommended it, stating portions were "small", but they really weren't.  SALSAS (CONTAINERS COME WITH MEAL) green: YES red: YES  SALSA (ON SIDE) pico de gallo: YES  MEATS Asada (gluten-based steak substitute): NO Chik-end (soy-based chicken substitute): NO turkey: NO ham: NO bacon: NO hotdog: NO tofu: MAYBE mushrooms: YES nopales (cactus): YES  DAIRY melting cheddar cheese: NO melting white cheese: MAYBE sprinkled cheese: MAYBE sour cream: MAYBE  DISHES - Classic Nachos ($8.99) with Chik-end: MAYBE. Mountainous. Avoided Chik-end. Sour cream, sprinkled cheese acceptable. Red/green salsas great when added to it. - Cuban Torta ($9.99): NO. Downright weird concept. - 3 Soft Street Tacos combo ($7.99): MAYBE. Vegetation (fresh cilantro, chopped onions) was fine. Out of 3 "meats" only mushrooms good. Supposed to come with rice & beans, never got those, hubby said via his burrito "you didn't miss anything". - Fried Rolled Potato Taco AKA Dorado ($1.50): NO. Bland. - Corn Quesadilla ($5.99): MAYBE. Mushrooms great. White cheese acceptable. - Classic Burrito ($7.99): NO. Ordered w/ mushrooms & nopales. Bland, virtually all rice, a few beans and very little mushrooms or nopales.  DRINKS Sangria soda ($2.50): YES. Arrived immediately. Tamarind soda ($2.50): YES. But had to go to counter to ask for drink halfway thru meal.  My tacos came to table quickly, but had to ask about potato taco & quesadilla after patiently waiting quite a while.  Overall consensus: BLAND. Where's the seasoning? The garlic? And spiciness? Only via hot sauce at front counter or red/green salsas. So do most vegans, or vegan americans, prefer bland food? This place would make you think so. Hubby went to the counter to ask for sliced jalapenos for his burrito, told they didn't have any. Cuban arrived with sliced jalapenos on it and stated so on the menu. WTF?  We won't be back.  PS With exception of 2 breakfast dishes (10am-1230pm) and "Supreme Fries" no avocado offered. And NO guacamole, at all. Crazy.

89DR8oPkeXuu0zV6N0ErsA.text: Poncho's makes the best vegan tacos I've ever had. I ordered the street tacos and had chicken, asada, and mushroom. My favorite was the asada but all are so flavorful and for street tacos they were full, you definitely get your monies worth here. Great beans and rice as well. The overall presentation was lovely even on my to go order. I will come here again next time I'm in town.

fvy5RtAYK8WuSaW5DXwj3g.text: Not really impressed. My son and I went there before a movie a few weeks back. The taco was ok in my book, I have had much better around town. I ordered chips and salsa which about $5, it was a meager amount of chips and decent blended salsa. Not worth $5. The salsa was decent, but I got a small amount of it. I was never asked what kind of salsa I might like, I was thinking I was getting a pico style, but again was not given any choices. Additionally, I tipped first which regretted since all they do is drop off your food. I had asked for water, what I got was 2 large cups of water with a tiny bit of ice. Not nitpicking, but since I tipped like $4 on a $15 order I was all around expecting much better. I don't plan on returning.

F1GcqN1b5rjTjILJOSVuTA.text: Wasted my entire 30 minute Lunch Break waiting for 1 Burrito, at 7pm! Food is good but not worth the wait, when you gave no time to eat it!

4s8AjVHUr80g4BgFa73vhA.text: This will be my second time here. Now I'm not Vegan but now I'm starting to question that. It's a great restaurant. First time I came here it looked different. _gtNkEISUI9aOuzJWn7_hg.text: Pancho's is my favorite Vegan restaurant in Las Vegas!!  Their new location in Anthem is a definite plus for me because it's a lot closer than the Pecos location.  They are in the Anthem Village area (near Von's and CVS) where the sushi place used to be.  My favorite vegan protein here is the chorizo.  I've tried it with street tacos, supreme fries, nacho cheese nachos, pozole and breakfast burritos. All amazing!

-JoYF0A31cAC-84kBSLl5Q.text: Yep. This place is legit.   Over a year and a half ago I made the conscious decision to stop eating meat. This means that most of the time when it's time to eat, I have to take control my of the ingredients. That means I have to make my own lunch and dinner to make sure that there are no animal-based products on my plate. It's not like the old days when I could just stop at any ol' fast food place and order anything from the menu. But now there are more and more vegan restaurant options popping up and I'm glad for that. One of those places I'm glad for is Panchos Vegan Tacos. I've had almost everything on their menu and I haven't been disappointed yet... and all the ingredients are vegan! Nice! I highly recommend this place. Their newest location in Anthem Hills is just as good, too.

UHtShKPinYe7haTeA_T5tQ.text: Alright, have been craving the Pancho's of yesterday year when they first opened, so we have come back twice since the last review. They have improved. Zero problems with our food at least. They still don't serve horchata regularly and there's never anyone at the register when we walk in... When the employee did come up, she was very nice though. Probably the nicest person we've interacted with here! Then this other lady came up to her talking about a problem with a customer stealing WHILE we were placing our order. I'm going 4 stars because they NEED consistency! We 100% recommend the supreme fries. We also love the asada and pastor tacos and all their cakes.

pRMC7SS-xeaaV4L2kQkSRQ.text: Holy ish this place is unbelievable and should be a Mecca for vegans in Las Vegas!!!  There are dozens of options and all are fully vegan.  This menu has burgers, fries, sopes, burritos, tamales, tacos and everything in between including horchata!  Great prices, I bought most everything on the menu and spent less than $50 to feed 6 hungry souls.  When I am biting into my strawberry cake I'll be thinking of you all, cold and in a restaurant that does not cater to you at all.  Come one, come all, this place is incredible!

b3uAS0tR8O5gZlh8dxYQ2g.text: What a meal! Mexican food is one of my best friends, and I love eating vegetarian/vegan when I can. This, then, is a great spot for me.   Food - I had the vegan taco plate, with one mushroom taco and two tacos with vegan meat. The mushrooms were sauteed to perfection and the vegan meat was cooked in a way that was flavorful and had a good texture. The plate came with rice and beans, which is always a must for any Mexican dish - and the portion was huge! To drink - Fountain Jones Soda?! Yum all the way. I have never had Jones Soda from the fountain, and that stuff was absolutely perfect.   Environment/Service - The staff was friendly, and the food came out relatively quickly. The environment was more on the casual side. Some booths and tables were spread out in a decent sized dining area. A lot of the tables were a little dirty, but hey - it's all good.   Will definitely be back to eat all the vegan menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's Vegan Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan taco plate

1fCcuzPIN5nLiscjpSEGOQ.text: This little taco shop is fantastic and so cute! After hearing many great things, I decided to travel across town and check them out with 2 friends. One friend is vegan with me and the other friend eats meat but doesn't mind vegan options. There was a small line of people waiting to order which allowed us time to look over the menu. We wanted 1 of everyhting as the menu looked so delicious but we picked our selected items. Note there is a menu located by the register of unavailable menu items so we couldnt try the tamales or potato tacos :(.   Their menu has so many options from tacos, wet burritos, enchiladas, posole, tamales, tostadas, nachos, desserts and etc. We placed our order to go and everything was ready in a timely manner. They were pretty busy with a full restaurant but most guests were waiting for to go orders. Our nachos and tostadas were bomb but the enchiladas with red sauce and wet burrito with red sauce were WAY too spicey. We also had the green sauce on the side and it was way TOO hot too so unfortunately we won't be ordering those options anymore. They were hard to enjoy but everything else was great!

z3SEb3snoaumGGuAD8UDoQ.text: Was a bit worried about getting my daily proteins, but most of all, the lack of satisfaction for my taste buds.  However, was pleasantly surprised on overall taste and flavors of this new Vegan joint that a lot of people have been telling me about for months.   In the end, I would recommend everyone try this vegan place out at least once to see if you like it or not, kinda like checking a "bucket list" if you're a meaty like me.

WEqhOYUGHFUzlbDe3iLPpw.text: Awesome authentic Mexican food, the street tacos and burritos are delicious. I live in Phoenix, and would eat here at least once a week if I lived in Phoenix. They offer a specials Tuesday-Sunday and Meatless Monday is 10% also they have a 10% off Yelp check in.

jf5tQ0VW6ln5dpjPXWBTsQ.text: Good food, not so good customer service. I've been coming here for the past year and half despite the shitty service. However today was my last time going there. I asked for no onion, but onions were put on my food. They take it back and 2 mins later bring me it again. All they did was pick out the onions (hopefully not with their hands). I could tell because there was still onions in it and it had a strong onion smell. Like are you that lazy to remake 4 small tacos?

CzNDtUH9AoPiF58uUgYKIw.text: I had the classic nachos and the soft street tacos when I dined here. The presentation of the nachos was so appetizing that one of the patrons asked if they could take a picture of my food. Their portions are also very generous, especially for the price.  The only thing I disliked was that the ratio of nachos to toppings was not proportionate. If you're like me and you love your toppings, this may be a problem for you. I wish the classic nachos were served with queso instead of shredded cheese so it would be easier to get cheese on every bite. I also wish there was more than just a drizzle of sour cream on top and a dollop of guacamole because there's no way you could get more than just a few chips with sour cream and guac on them.  The street tacos tasted great, I have no complaints there. Next time I eat here I will probably be ordering more tacos instead of nachos. Overall, I think it's a nice place for vegan Mexican food.

oI9fTqscNYcYtOuMMLuHYg.text: Pancho's is my spot! Vegan Mexican food that isn't oily and wont have you leaving feeling like you ate "junk" vegan food like most places popping up. Green tamales are my number one pick, little on the spicy side but it works. The tacos whichever you pick never disappoint.  Glad the expansion is happening as it can get a little crowded during standard peek times.

d5_lHiUGMAxTgMy_OQ7pag.text: I've been to Pancho's about 4 or so times now and it never disappoints. I am always hesitant about Mexican food because it tends to make me sick.. but Not here!  The tacos are the perfect size and I love to come here for the Taco Tuesday deal when I can. The soy chorizo is probably my favorite, and so much tastier than actual chorizo.   The fries are MASSIVE!! I've tried both kinds twice and each time we haven't been able to finish even half of them. But so good. The cheese is delicious. Again I try to stay away from dairy because it makes me sick but Pancho's cheese just has such a great taste and doesn't make you feel bloated.  This place is VERY tiny so be prepared for that! Ive has a time where we had to wait around for seats. The staff is super quick, and even when the place is packed they work hard to get you your food quick.   All in all this is a great place and the food outways anything to keep me coming back!

o7eALtk_hmoD0HTlcYNjgA.text: So good, so fast, and really inexpensive! The plant-based chicken was so yummy that I went out trying to find a similar vegan chicken at the store (kind of like Gardein but better in my opinion). The casual eatery is lovely -- and the beans are especially great. I loved the tamale and the nachos are a very good time, especially if you can't have dairy and are craving goopy cheese. I can't believe the prices are this low, quite honestly -- they could easily justify charging double and I'd still pay it.

EnIGFQczVuaXzDpjOUVlfw.text: Great food, I love this place. No guilt what's so ever. The tacos are delicious and the rice and beans are outstanding.

VPS0CKwjNF16le2jc4o5Ow.text: Been Vegan for a few years but been eating Mexican food my whole life. We found out about Pancho's when we moved to Vegas a year ago and I can honestly say this is some legit Mexican food. Hand down my favorite place to eat in town. The only down side is that I want to order about 5 or 6 different items every time I go. Going to be a big problem for me when the new one opens about 5 minutes from our house. Oh yeah and they have the impossible burger too!

13MTkv9l9ksgcZ44oHLbYg.text: Found an all vegan taco shop, yes! I drove to Vegas to meet friends and stopped by here at the end of my drive before going to strip which has more limited vegan options. I ordered the Friday special, a burrito. It was a lot of beans and rice in a large tortilla. This definitely isn't healthy vegan food, it's comfort food and very hearty and filling. Also very simple, for my protein I got mushrooms and there was some lettuce and tomato but that was it. It ended up being two meals for me and I loved the tortilla. It's a very casual place, you order at the counter and there's cafeteria like seating. The mexican place next door has vegan options as well if you don't find something you want on the menu. It's located in a more run down area just off the strip at a major intersection so there's lots of traffic and congestion by the restaurant but for me it felt like it was worth the trip. It's also by the university so saw a lot of students dropping in. The other thing I love was how affordable the food was. You sometimes see someone add a vegan label and hike up the price even if you're getting something super simple but Panchos Vegan was very reasonably priced. I liked my food a lot, wish I had room for dessert. They had a huge menu and lots of different appetizers, entrees, protein options, desserts, and tacos. Would highly recommend for any vegans visiting Vegas. it is a little inconvenient if you don't have a car because you have to leave the strip but if you have time, I think it's worth the detour.

3Dn4CxJqaRqSS0hgFS6VgQ.text: I've been to this Pancho's location a few times over the last year or two and I'll continue to visit when I get a hankering for it.   The tamales are delicious and it's nice to know that I can go to a restaurant and get these delicious delights without the use of lard. The veggie meat that is used in the green tamales isn't the best consistency. It has zero texture and although it looks like meat, it's just mushy. The street tacos are delicious and flavorful.   A note or two on the service and atmosphere.: When entering into the restaurant and guests to the right to order, one can see cables hanging under the desk, packing boxes behind the person taking the order and employee drinks in plain site. It always feels a bit awkward ordering, like the person taking the order isn't at all happy to be there and they barely smile or make guests feel welcome. About half the time that I order a glass of water, it makes it to me. The food runners awkwardly place the tray on your table (or a nearby table) when bringing out food. Either use a "tray-stand" or hold the tray while taking food off it, this is food running 101.   Overall this place it ok and I hope they pay attention to yelp reviews and adjust accordingly.

yhGCdWJkh0sFNOWzGO4-GQ.text: Tried the Pancho's in Anthem last night. Having been to the other locations, I expected similiar service. I am deeply disappointed. The food was good, but the air conditioning was broken (90 degrees outside and hotter inside.) The only person tasked with helping customers in the dining area, was inept at customer service. AND if that wasn't enough, we watched her spill chips on the middle of the floor and during our entire visit ( at least 45 minutes) she never cleaned them up and led people through the chips to break and distribute evenly throughout the dining area.  I've been vegan for almost 7 years, but this experience has turned me off to ever trusting Pancho's again. If you allow for this type of uncleanliness and outwardly bad service, what are you doing to the food behind kitchen walls? Thanks, but no thanks. There are soooo many other vegan options out there that take every customer seriously.

nVJmIVd80sOpn5yGCxyhOw.text: I came here based on the reviews and for the fact that my cousin has been wanting to bring me here as well.. well I'm in Vegas visiting, finally so we came here to eat a late lunch. When you drive up to this place, it's in a strip mall with a large banner that says vegan mexican food. The door says Pancho's so I knew we were at the right spot. You order inside and than they give you a number and have you sit down in the dinning area. The cashier was older, some what friendly. We did dine in and there were only two tables open that didn't have a mess all over them.. so we ended up grabbing the one by the kitchen.   Anyways we sat down and didn't have to wait long for our food to come out. The waitress brought out our food and we realized that one of the items she brought out we didn't order. We even pulled out the receipt to later find out the cashier charged us for a combo meal instead of a single item. Granted they let us keep the combo and gave us back the money for the mistake, but that's besides the point.   Onto the food. I ordered the potato taquitos, they were very bland. They came out looking good, mini salad on top and all.. but the taquitos themselves were just potatoes shoved inside a corn tortilla and deep fried. I tasted no seasoning on the potato. Granted I got two of these and I had to dip it in some salsa to give it some flavor. I also got the vegan ceviche, it tasted nothing like ceviche. It honestly tasted like overly spicy salsa on a soggy tostada with a spoonful of fake guacamole on top. Lastly I ordered some horchata, ya that was a mistake.. it had the aftertaste of bubblegum.. which in fact I knew right away that it wasn't original. If you're going to promote your business as an authentic vegan mexican restaurant, than do just that.. I've been to plenty of vegan mexican restaurants in other states that taste authentic.. this place wasn't and I was disappointed for the fact that I wish it was better.

WupNWpuidiYWypAYV88jtg.text: Mmmmm...vegan nacho cheese nachos...Pancho's, what have you done to me?! Those dang nachos...  Anyway, I digress--not only are the nachos delicious, so is everything that comes out of this is place. The best part? EVERYTHING on the menu is vegan (and is affordable AND muy authentico!).  The ambiance is super casual: grab a menu and make your way to the front to place your order. Once you've gotten that under way, find an empty table and relax while the kitchen conducts a little magic. Before you know it, Pancho's fantastic staff will be out with your food. If you're anything like me, you will order way too much and then try to eat it all because it's amazing (no judgement here, after all, I feel ya!).   It's noteworthy to mention that Pancho's is great for  herbivores and omnivores alike. I've been numerous times and my company is always non-vegan; I've repeatedly heard nothing but praise for the amazing food. Do yourself and try out one of my new favorite spots, I promise you'll love it.

YaCVmVpjhY4eu1--dt_PSQ.text: Wow, this was just what I needed. The food here is delicious and the prices are very reasonable especially for being vegan. I had been wanting some Mexican food other than fried potato tacos. Don't get me wrong, I appreciate that option at several local restaurants but Pancho's has a full menu.  I had the Chilaquiles with both green and red sauce and it was really good. I decided to add a full size taco and picked the mushroom as the "meat" and what a great choice. It was the best thing we ate. My wife who is NOT vegan loved the taco too. She ordered two potato tacos and was not expecting much but she came away really impressed. The chips and salsa were good too. We saw a couple of guys order the nacho plate, man it was huge.   The place had a continuous flow. You walk up an order and they call you up. Place was really plain but nice and most importantly clean. Will come back when I am in town.

Ku0DjwXoaNKQqykq21iOEg.text: The food is great, I've been coming here at least every other month for about a year and have never been disappointed. I'm not typically vegan, and can say I genuinely enjoy their chick-end street tacos better than any street tacos I've gotten anywhere else. lK5NBMTGriczecZciuqA8w.text: I'm new to the Vegan world as of January 1st but my friend who helped get me on board with this cruelty free lifestyle change took me to Panchos .  The food is really really good for the price especially being Vegan but I can give 5 stars because my Tamale was essentially the most dried out thing that wasn't even edible and they messed up our order .  We dined inside but before that we stood in a pretty long line to be helped . When ordered a blonde guy with a pony tale was going to take our order till I asked what the products were made with (I have a soy intolerance ) anyway he had Zack take the order in which not only did we order lunch but my friends got their dinner to go and asked for sauce on the side which didn't end up happening and had to be remade later on . Once we placed our order we found a seat.  The food came out as it was ready I guess but my friends all got their food and I was waiting for my one asada taco which was delicious , potato taco which I wasn't wowsers over and I already discussed my jalapeno and cheese Tamale that essentially was just a waste of money . I can say Vegan tamales I got from sprouts and made myself were better which is why I can't go to four stars but especially with the Service .  My food came last and they didn't offer or bring me any salsa or dipping sauces . There was a woman browsing around asking if we were okay but she didn't really know where my food was and later when our to go order was wrong nobody seemed apologetic but they made sure to charge for the refills .  Overall it's affordable Vegan with tons of variety and decent quality items..   My friends got nachos with mushroom which were okay but I felt lacking sauce ...  I really liked the taste of the asada and for vegan it's worth trying I just hope you get better help than I received

QkjuDSNeY267c1w9sjvPSA.text: Look no further for your taco Tuesday fix. I'd recommend the fried potato rolled taco combo plate ($8.99). It comes with 3 potato tacos and a side of rice and beans. Everything tasted great - I had zero complaints. No meal would be complete at a taco shop without some horchata. As far as I know, Pancho's Tacos is the only place in town with vegan horchata. I've also tried the Gran Torta ($9.99), which is not to fuck with. Seriously, it's loaded up with chorizo, ham, cheese, and who knows what else. Just eat it.  Oh yeah, did I forget to mention the menu is 100% vegan? Pancho's is a vegan hotspot, but on the two times that I've been here omnis have waltzed in with no idea this place was even a vegan restaurant. Notably, they stayed to try out the food so kudos to Pancho's for exposing the masses to good Mexican vegan food.    INSIDER TIP: Word on the street is that the owner of this lovely taco shop was a professional soccer player!  YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2017: #12

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's Vegan Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried rolled potato tacos combo plate

Tq3tmOCo0joc9ZlsPyuRgQ.text: I think it's important to start off this review letting you know that I'm not vegan, far from it. However, one of my favorite foods is Mexican. To say I was skeptical of this place would be an understatement. Boy was I wrong!  I was in Las Vegas visiting a friend who moved out there. She's vegan and suggested we come here as it's one of her favorites. I hesitantly agreed, but I'm glad that I went in with an open mind.  I guess my concept of vegan food was limited to tofu so I was pleasantly surprised when I read things like chorizo and asada on the menu. Of course it wasn't meat, but it wasn't tofu either! Also the menu was extensive and has familiar Mexican food items like tortas, sopes, and enchiladas. Of course it also has the staples: tacos and burritos.  I was throughly impressed by the prices and more importantly the prices in relation to quality and portion. It was right in line with prices I see at any of my favorite local Mexican restaurants. I was expecting higher than normal prices, maybe because I'm from LA and anything vegan typically carries a higher price tag here.  But it all came down to taste. I had a wet burrito. It was recommended by one of the girls working there to get it with both the red and green sauce. What a great idea! The two sauces complimented each other perfectly! My friend and I also shared supreme fries. These rivaled any supreme fries I've had on any drunken night and if I were drunk, you could have fooled me telling me the cheese was vegan!  This is a must try spot! Be open minded and I promise you'll enjoy it!

bMKx08eskRJ1dTzZXC2mmQ.text: This place was amazing friendly staff and the vegan super fries were better then I have had anywhere else! I will definitely return to this establishment to try other dishes!!

o744NfcWt67eFeAUuNia0Q.text: I never thought I'd say this, but their vegan al pastor tacos are better than the al pastor at most traditional taco shops. Talk about seasoning!   Pancho's is bringing affordable vegan food to the masses and what better way than by Mexican food! I've eaten here a handful of times and my food never disappoints. I have to admit I've had all of their meat and I'm sure you know my favorite is al pastor. I've had their tacos, burritos, quesadillas, and nachos. They also carry soup and tamales.  If you need a recommendation then definitely do the tacos or a quesadilla on corn tortilla. I feel like the burrito has way too much everything else in it and then the non-melted cheese on the nachos are a put off. The quesadillas with melted vegan cheese is amazing!  My only suggestion to get that last star is their customer service and the store cleanliness. I'm sure they run on a tight profit margin, but they need to step up their ordering system to be more organized. Also they could really spice up their beans and rice. Hate to admit but they are pretty bland.   Definitely check out Pancho's to help save the earth. They have awesome weekly specials like taco Tuesday! Theirs includes three tacos and a drink for less than five bucks. It's very affordable and centrally located.

Y5zkVqvNn5CD66qEMstSOw.text: Another Vegan Mexican place!! Flavors are basically the same compared to a regular taco spot, but it's vegan! The tacos were delicioussss and 4 of them was enough for me to be satisfyingly full lol - and trust me, I can eat a lot. Their food comes out fast too. Their restaurant was fairly busy the day we came in, but we got our food quick. The staff was very polite and professional. Greeted me as I walked in, checked on me while I was eating, and said goodbye to me as I left.  Only downside I can say is that their horchata was not that good. It tastes very powdery and the residue sticks in your mouth. Hopefully, the horchata is different the next time around. The jamaica was a good though - not too sweet, and has a touch of that tart flavor. On the plus side, they give free refills for the horchata and jamaica.

NlBfTCLGRxMB-KLvEJrlMw.text: I came here after seeing so many good posts about this place in the "Las Vegas Vegans" Facebook group. Honestly, I was disappointed...  I told the owner to order me his 2 favorite dishes. He chose the enchiladas and a torta. I was not impressed with either. The enchiladas came with rice and beans. The rice was okay, but the beans lacked flavor (tasted like water).   It seems as though the chef went through the vegan freezer section and bought all the fake meats and cheeses, put them together, and called it cooking. This is 100% fast food for junk food vegans. If you are looking for food with any nutritional value, this is not the place.   That being said, I do think this place is a great transition for stubborn carnivorous junk food eaters. You might even be able to trick a meat eater into eating here! I applaud Pancho's for spreading veganism and was happy to see how busy they were when I went in. Over half the tables were full when I went!   The owner and the staff were incredibly friendly. The owner kept checking on me, and he was ready to answer any questions I might have had. So although I'm not the biggest fan of the food, I really like the staff and appreciate their spread of vegan knowledge. I honestly wish nothing but success for this place!   *They may want to change their name though, because Pancho's Kitchen is AMAZING healthier vegan Mexican food so people may have higher expectations if they see Pancho's Tacos with the similar name.

h9L6JNtING2d-XxxCjmOkQ.text: I have heard rave reviews from the people in my Las Vegas vegans group about ponchos vegan tacos. Today I made a special trip there because I couldn't wait any longer to try this. It was completely worth it, I'm very happy to say! From the moment I walked in I received such friendly and warm service ...not sure what the man's name was behind the counter, maybe he was the owner? Or just an awesome employee. Anyhow I told him it was my first time and he made some suggestions to which I chose the Cuban torta. He brought it out not long after, and it looked like a typical sandwich, one bite into it though and this was heaven! The bread was perfectly crisp yet soft inside, the produce was fresh and cold, the faux meats were tender -not rubbery -and flavorful enough. The avocado was perfectly ripe! And just the right right amount of onions to give it a little kick.  I will definitely be making trips out here for ponchos vegan tacos again... And again!

IfXjM-jFVgtjfWlxRgFVrQ.text: One of the most difficult things for me transitioning into veganism is the thought of giving up my favorite Mexican foods. This place has completely assuaged that fear of never tasting asada, al pastor, and chorizo ever again. The flavors and textures are completely on point, I couldn't have asked for a better food experience. We also had a great service experience as well.  I got a northern Mexican sope al pastor, a taco de asada, and a wet burrito al pastor as well. The tacos are authentic street tacos, so all they have are the meat, cilantro, and onion, which worried me because so many meat substitutes are overcooked, but it was absolutely perfect. I would recommend everything that I ordered to anyone, vegan or not! :)

The tacos were delicious and the sopes too! I loved the horchata and that it was made with almond milk. Must try the green sauce. Forever a customer and telling all my friends to try this place. Thank you guys so much for creating a whole restaurant that uses no animal products. Veganism is the way! #supportveganspots #savetheanimals

dD3kCOBt81YxZp2RxLbKYA.text: I have been coming here for about a year. They have such and amazing selection for 100% vegan. I am a habitual orderer. I love the wet burrito with asada and green sauce (sometimes it gets pretty spicy) and I love their original veggie burger. Lately they only have the impossible burger :( but that's ok I get the burrito! They seriously have 1 of the best burgers I have ever had I'm very sad they started promoting the impossible. The staff has always been awesome. They have grown in options and I have not tried many of them all but my husband enjoys the torta cubana and the sopes! You can never go wrong with Pancho's! 7cvLeFLx5RIFk4nUM9A00A.text: There needs to be more places like this.  Portions are huge, food is very flavorful.  I had the Gran Torta and the Poole with "chicken".  Both were great. I plan to visit them again in the future to see if they have any improvements or new menu items. My rolled potato tacos were really, really lacking in filling. zaOpETf_g9uPy05pzWy2zA.text: I ordered the mole enchiladas, pozole, and rolled potato tacos. Pozole was good, not out of this world good but ok, got it with the chick-end. The potato tacos were very very yummy, but honestly never ordered any potato tacos that weren't... you can never go wrong with that. So food quality I'd say 3.5 stars. I took off another star for the terrible customer service. The guy taking the orders (older guy in his 40's) in the front was arrogant and rude. Seemed annoyed that a customer came in, acted like he was super busy and the place was pretty empty. I asked which meat he'd recommend for the pozole and he looked so annoyed and said "I really don't know, whatever you feel like", was very unfriendly and snappy. I also witnessed a Uber Eats guy come in and was told they were out of the horchata which had been ordered... It was 4 pm how do you run out of such popular drink at that time of the day? Also, why allow the order to be placed for an item you don't have? Then, another lady came in a little after us and ordered a burger. Minutes later they came out and told her they were out of buns that they would have to make it with regular sandwich bread. Wtf? Oh, and I forgot to mention that I noticed my mole being heated in the microwave, not sure if that is the reason why it was so thick. But honestly, I'll stick with my vegan restaurants here in California. Maybe next time I'm in Vegas I'll find a good quality Vegan place that treats customers nicely.

GlKbKgsSdZxCH7P_RiePtw.text: Green chick-end enchiladas changed my life and will probably change yours too. Love the place!

x7i_JSIukjG-bRKN_75yDw.text: Yum! We are so excited to have found this great vegan restaurant through Yelp. We left stuffed... the classic nachos are huge. We also enjoyed a wet burrito, street tacos and a sope. All vegan and all delicious. Great find!

DxGaiZXZCriAYyq-CITsTw.text: I tried this place and was very hopeful after reading mixed reviews. So- their food is decent but not like super good. Their soups are delicious- prob my favorite part of my order. The carnitas street tacos were pretty good, wish they had a bit more seasoning on the "meat", their red salsa was bomb so I just slathered it with that and lime juice, you could almost not tell it wasn't actually meat. I also ordered the potato rolled tacos and was not impressed- it's like two French fries in a corn tortilla and then I specifically asked them to put the cheese on the side (because sometimes I don't like vegan cheeses and I did not like theirs), but they put the cheese all over my tacos anyway and when I called to complain (via Grubhub) because I couldn't eat the tacos with the nasty cheese all over them I was told that my order was right and that they put the cheese on the side and I will not be refunded. They did agree to refund me for the horchata that I order and didn't receive.   My overall take is I wish this place had better customer service. If they screw up your order and you can't eat it because of it, you will not be refunded- they will blame the customer and you'll be out of money. Really bad bad service, wish it wasn't so... I won't be returning for that specific reason. It's the principle...they said I was lying about my food being wrong instead of taking responsibility for their mistake.   Okay so today it's over a month since I wrote the review for Panchos and I was literally like attacked on Facebook by them for writing a real review and in their response they just straight up completely lied, then made it so I couldn't even respond to them because I guess they needed "the last word". Big tip- don't accuse your customers of lying when they are not. I'm not the only person commenting on your awful customer service. Just fix it!!! I've attached a pic of the Facebook post where they were upset about my review and then disabled me from responding. To be clear- they never offered a refund like I've detailed before. And Grubhub was not the issue, they were. I will still use Grubhub to order food but will never go to this place, that says something!  Also, I found a vegan place here in Vegas I love called vegetation and they don't blame their customers or try to shift the blame to Grubhub when they mess up, I promise!    Maybe the next time they get a bad review they will actually reach out to the customer to correct it instead of just lying on the internet and saying they did. The management here are just straight up liars. Bad service, don't go!!!!

DGPvIL4U3GQ3TrfFt_5EbQ.text: I stumbled upon this place when a flyer was placed in my windshield I've always wanted an all vegan Mexican food restaurant in vegas rather than traveling all the way to LA. Lol the place has a lot of potential but it seems a little sad like make it look Mexican with interior design where's the Mexican music you know make it look like I'm at home eating (give it a vibe) it was so quiet. XumTFRwpnD08HDHOX8c5Lg.text: This is my favorite vegan  restaurant. However the past three weeks have been hit and miss. I've been going consistently, 4-6 times a week, over the past two months. My orders have taken upwards of 8-10 mins after ordering. The rice has been old, and hard. The pinto beans have been dry and semi-hard. The food has been lukewarm and the "asada", has been dry and hard. I'm hoping the owners are reading these reviews and are open to rectifying these issues immediately. I gave three stars because the staff are always pleasant. Even though I'm offended they're serving me old food

hLALDdDOkbXeAwYG5VHa1w.text: New to the vegan lifestyle and was happy to find a Mexican food option!!  I went in and tried their Tuesday Taco combo plate!  It was 4 street tacos with my choice of vegan "meat"!  I chose 2 asada, 1 pastor and 1 chorizo.  I liked them all except the chorizo had more of a vegan texture with the flavoring of chorizo.  The other two actually had me fooled, in a good way with lots of flavor.  The two salsas were perfect additions, but I preferred the green one to the red one.  I got a plate to go for a friend and she liked the asada more than the pastor, but agreed that it was flavorful!  Can not wait to go back!

SToLuFCKhipDdvrxyPbeyQ.text: I love this place with all my heart. When I went vegan I thought I gave up my street taco life (I was so wrong). They have plant based meats for asada, al pastor, chorizo, chicken and offer veggies like mushrooms and nopales (cactus).   The menu has everything from street tacos, to pozole, to tamales, to loaded nachos... and even ice cream now?! And donuts on the weekend! I've been here at least a dozen times and always leave with a happy belly and wallet. Great pricing and each day of the week has its own special.  Monday-meatless Monday 10% off (must mention it) Tuesday-Taco Tuesday  Wednesday-classic nachos Thursday-tostadas Friday-burritos Saturday-sopes Sunday-breakfast platter special  My favorite thing here hands down are the asada street tacos. The quesadilla is dynamite as well. I don't think the cheese nachos are very popular since they always make sure I want those instead of classic nachos but they are so delicious. The cheese is a sauce and it comes with jalapenos. You can add any "meat" for $1 --ASADA! Simple and delicious. Classic nachos are loaded up with sour cream, shredded cheese, guac and more and also good.   The wet burrito is humongous and you can get it with both red and green sauces. Loaded fries are a dream as well. Can you tell I've basically tried the whole menu? They even have a huge breakfast burrito served until 12 (I think) any day of the week. It's tasty but I wish they put potatoes or fries in the burrito for better texture. That's really my toughest critic!   They are in the middle of a renovation and expansion so they have a temporary set up for the register and waiting area. The staff is always so nice and the same sweet lady is always there to take my order or bring us our food. I love you Panchos!

UlYiGSDzjc0EOuwySe-MMg.text: Panchos is the place to go to when craving Mexican food, Vegan or not!   My favorite is the Asada street tacos! They're so delicious and simple, Two just never seems like enough.   Tonight we ordered the 3 taco special that comes with a drink for 6.99. Those were great as always, my fav.   We also ordered the the classic nachos, oh my gosh were those huge! Way more than the two of us could eat and they were delicious too. I forgot to snap a picture of just how big and pretty they were. I liked them a lot though,  I wish the cheese could have been melted into the chips before adding all the rest of the toppings. For the cheese being vegan it is good but would be better melted.   As for Panchos itself, this place is always busy! They're actually expanding right now into the unit right next door. The set up is great. They take the orders in the old room and you sit and wait in the expansion room. The menu also looks larger than the last time I was there. They're offering burgers, no-so-tuna melts and even breakfasts.   I've heard the tamales were good, I need to try those next time. They sell them by the dozen, just check ahead of time if they have any.   Thumbs up to Panchos!  Yummm!

4uPXjqvkqxhdw6oF7Mb6Nw.text: This place's food is extremely well made and delicious. However, the wait times is extremely long on some occasions when I've had the chance to visit. We would wait for 20 minutes just for a cup of water. But overall the food is good and it's only occasionally, when the service is not consistent with the food quality.

0OruGealWfaRKmMMpLx0Cg.text: Vegan junk food.  I would personally rate the food a two star but the service and concept deserves a five star!  This is not gourmet vegan mex. I would compare it to the omnis version of a "Robertos" type place. Junk food.  100% vegan. Grub Hub and Uber Eats.  We tried a variety of items most of which have Daiya :( cheese. But I can overlook that because we completely forgot to request minus. *punches self in face*  Chorizo Quesadilla- not sure what we were thinking ordering this, the chorizo was yum but we couldn't get past the Daiya goo factor. It was warm yet had that outer crispiness, prepared perfectly.  Wet Burrito-best item we ordered, huge a filled with yumminess we opted for Ascada and glad we did.  Potato rolled tacos- fried and crisp these were super yum but of course they are fried. The white looking lettuce and mayo globs were a shock and total taste turnoff but the fresh sliced avocado on top made up for the goo globs.  Nachos Al Pastor-covered and piled high these had amazing flavor. The meat choice I picked was a great decision. Once again I should have opted minus the Daiya shreds goo and the glowing bright white lettuce.  The hibiscus water is soooo yummy. Its NOT sweet and the tart taste goes perfect with the food. Wish I opted to try the Horchata but neither hubs nor I like cinnamon nor care for sweet stuff.  All and all the food is fast food, I'm willing to try other items like the tacos....but we do not like corn tortillas and wish they would opt for greener lettuce and less processed products.   Better than Taco Bell, def not health food, yet cruelty free compassion based grub. Support local business.   Just A-Ok.

IgZlyo1Tp-WoClOt4v1fJw.text: Man this is the first time I've been here and I've NEVER tasted vegan meat nor vegan cheese .. I'm not vegan but I eat vegan food .. and this restaurant is the best.. I love sopes but when I came here I'm obsessed with them now! I do recommend this place to anyone and it's very affordable 3.99 for a sope.. it's just so bomb!! eT9souyy_KvbUxkYDwBFhg.text: I missed eating authentic Mexican food . This is as close as it gets! I love the Asada fries, Sopes, chicken quesadilla ,agua de Jamaica/Watermelon and tacos de al pastor. My bf really loves to get the torta de asada but with the bolio extra toasted. I recently tried the carne asada burrito and Agua de Horchata . Unfortunately , it wasn't as good as i expected . The meat resembled veggie  beef crumbles with too much cumin .  The horchata was weird and very liquidity. Kinda like watered down almond milk and cinnamon lol. I was so excited to try it. Maybe the next batch of carne asada will hit the spot. Regardless, I still love this place. Service is fast and you can get a filling meal under $12.

xhFEGIqoIkAjpt5qpDmBBQ.text: Beware FOOD POISONING!!! I questioned about going to this place after seeing it featured on "Dirty Dining" more than once. However, I believe in second chances. The few times I have been here, customer service was terrible. The food is okay, nothing crazy special to rave about. Definitely over priced for what you get.  Moving forward, I went here yesterday for lunch, and now I'm suffering from food poisoning. I called to inform them something was bad. The manager basically said that it was impossible for me to be sick from their food because they don't use meat or dairy products to cause cross-contamination. I don't think he understands that germs and bacteria can be spread through unsafe food handling procedures such as simple hand washing. Worst of all, the manager didn't even offer to follow-up with the kitchen or look into the situation.  If someone is reporting a sickness, whether you think you're at fault or not, the situation needs to be addressed in the kitchen in a serious manner to ensure other customers' health are not put at risk.  I did not call to complain; I called to inform.  All, in all... They have a history of not passing health inspections. If you decide to eat here, just be aware of what you're eating.

4-Igo8SfW9uiyMLgY7-3sw.text: Amazing!!! So happy for this place. I live in summerlin, so its a bit far, but so worth it! I had the wet asada burrito with half green half red sauce... incredible! I have had some great burritos in my days, but this one, beats them all.  There Menu is super extensive yet easy to understand. They have a lot of options, soup, tacos, burritos, Tamales, and all kinds of different fresh fruit drinks. The price is honest, amd the food is superb. I will keep coming to this place because thet have the authentic taste down. The rice and beans were spot on.  The play list playing of music was awesome as well. very inviting and clean restaraunt and everyone was so nice.  I phone ordered my meal and when i got there the place was so clean, and the atmospheric vibe was way up, i decided to stay. As i sat down a guy made a comment about me phone ordering it in and said it was smart. We got talking, and another customer jumped in and said "its great here, i come all the time and i am not even  Vegan" and i swear he had like three different things going on and they all looked good. The other guy had the taco deal with a side a guac and cheese and it looked great but in the end i am so happy with what i got.  By the way they have a special everyday amd on tuesday its "taco tuesday" deal.  At any rate, hope you check this spot out and love as much as i do.

m45SaTzAfqZ5izuf1sg9GA.text: Love love love! Amazing food! OHMYGOSH. The ONLY reason I gave a 4 star review was because I thought the beans would be refried and not whole. Not a big deal for most people, but I was extremely bummed out   But would definitely go back again for sure!

WJvempZWOEyVDgG7UsRcIA.text: I don't live in Vegas, but I've visited about three times within the last year. My first visit to Pancho's was before they started to expand the space. I had a couple of tacos and a sope, while my partner had the pozole. The food was on point! The tacos were pretty much the selling point for me, so when we visited the other day for our third time, we each got a trio of the "meat" tacos (al pastor, asada, chorizo). The tacos were packed full of protein and flavor. I highly recommend this place to vegetarians/vegans and even omnivores. The food has always been stellar. I just wish there was a location in Tucson, AZ. But, I guess Pancho's is just another reason to visit Vegas! Also, the location is undergoing some amazing renovations, expanding the space and branding their name.

YGu93Nkn9opT3SE8Gsal-A.text: The pozole!   Omg.   I need more.  I will be back for sure.   Also notable, the loaded fries supreme w/no meat, quesadilla and a burrito with cactus and mushrooms.     So happy this place is so close to my house.   Was told they are opening a new location in Huntington Beach as well.  TRY IT EVEN IF YOU ARE NOT VEGAN, you might change your mind.

klMghDJTJUj1YUpzCJGhNw.text: I can't believe that there is a Mexican restaurant that is completely vegan! And on top of that, it's actually really, really good!  So I actually had this place bookmarked a few weeks ago since its not that far from where I live. I had looked at a few of the pictures and saw the 4.5 star ranking and figured any place with this many good reviews I need to try. I saw they had Vegan tacos but I assumed they just had a few items, not the whole menu. I'm not vegan, but I have recently been trying some vegan food in an attempt to eat healthier. I found the fact that this place is completely plant based to be a pleasant surprise.  So my wife and I ordered too much food as usual (thank you for to-go boxes) and were very happy with almost everything. We got the nachos with "asada", five different types of tacos, potato taquitos and a Cuban torta.  The nacho cheese sauce was fantastic and you couldn't tell it wasn't real cheese. We asked how it was made and told us it is made with potatoes, carrots and nutritional yeast, plus some secret ingredients. I would eat this over the usual neon yellow nacho cheese any day.  The torta was my favorite thing, and again I couldn't tell it wasn't real meat. It had "ham" and "turkey" and "hot dogs", along with tofu, avocado and "cheese". Though I wouldn't call this a Cuban, it was easily the equal of any other torta I have ever had.  The taquitos were one of only two things that weren't that great (I'll get to the other later). It's not that they were bad, it's just that they weren't as good as the other food we had. They potato didn't really stand out as a filler for the taquitos, but they were pretty decent after being dipped in salsa. If you are a person that likes taquitos more for the crunch of the fried tortilla than the meat inside you'll probably like these. I could see myself ordering them again if I was in the right mood.  For the tacos we got one "asada", one "pastor", one "chorizo", one "chicken" and one mushroom. The mushroom (the only one not trying to imitate meat), while far from traditional was delicious. Along with the mushroom we also loved the chorizo, which you couldn't tell wasn't real chorizo. The chicken was also very good and tasted like chicken, and the pastor could pass for pork but was a little to sweet for my taste. The only one we didn't really care for that much was the "asada". We also ordered the asada on our nachos and it was by far the least favorite "meat" we tried. It wasn't so much that it was bad, but it didn't taste anything like carne asada or beef in general for that matter. Its consistency was more like a sausage than steak, and it's probably the only thing we wouldn't get again.  There was also one additional meat, cactus, which we didn't try but I guess we will get that next time. I can't really hold the "asada" against them considering I have yet to find a vegan substitute for beef that actually taste like beef. I have now had vegan cheese, eggs, pork and chicken and loved each one, but I guess beef is much harder to pull off.  The prices were on par with any other Mexican place you'd go to, though I thought the torta for $10 was a little high, despite how good it was. The nachos on the other hand for $5, with the option to add meat for a $1, are a fantastic deal.  Even if your not vegan, but you enjoy Mexican food, I highly recommend coming here. If you are vegan then this place is a must.

-8n3ApsMfQqVdyOy6ETgfA.text: I went there for late lunch and ordered one asada, one al pastor taco, asada sope and an horchata. The seitan for the asada is flavorful, however, the texture is too spongy for my taste.  The al pastor seitan had the same type of spongy texture as the asada, but this one lacked  flavor. I wouldn't order it again.   What I  was really pleased with  was the sope. The dough was not greasy, not undercooked, not too thick.  Also, the beans were on point, soft and had its own flavor. The sour cream didn't  really taste like anything and the shredded cheese looked more like mozzarella cheese  instead of queso fresco or cotija which is what it's  traditionally served with. The horchata water was by far the only item you couldn't  that was vegan. It had that sweet and cinnamony taste that regular horchata has. I knocked down 3 stars due to the following:  So, I left this place thinking about giving it 3 stars, maybe 4, maybe. However,  around dinner time I called in to place an order for a pick up. I knew they closed at 8:00 PM and it was 7:40 already which is why I called it in. A man answered the phone and when I asked him if I could place an order for a carry out, he paused and said " you wanna place an order right before we close?" Mind you, they still had another 20 minutes to go. How rude. I told him I knew that and would be there within 10 minutes. He then proceeded to take my order.  Also, the establishment seemed cleaned but it was extremely hot in there and when I arrived the cashier lady was all by herself at the front. She was taking orders, taking them out, cleaning tables. She was really hustling. And she (cashier/bus lady/server) told me  that the A/C wasn't working  properly so maybe I just went on the wrong day. No big deal. Regardless, the place is missing decorations. The walls seemed to have been painted recently  with a burnt orange color. And that's all that was done to it. Also, the chairs and tables are extremely worn down.   This place has potential but lacks customer service, uniformity and the food needs improvement.

ZM_fNarMWYBL_3n-BNx20w.text: Super great mexican food & it's vegan! It's pretty central las vegas & like 3 minutes from me so it's even better. We've gone back a few times & tried new things each time. I really loved the Cuban torta & green Chile enchiladas w rice & beans. Horchata & Jamaica water are offered, but I've had Horchata each time. Really cool people, & we feel comfortable hanging out there. Everyone should try it. My parents are old school & confused by vegan food but they actually loved it & want to go back.

6g-Um0PN2C6QgGnVGm73BA.text: I really wanted to love this, but I will have to give it three stars, and I may be a little generous. The restaurant itself was clean and didn't have loud annoying music blaring, I got my order to go and that is where the problems started. I ordered dinner for myself and my husband, along with dessert. I was unable to eat the dessert because it was just way to sweet. I like sweet things, but this was just too sugary. The cake seemed a little hard, so I don't think it was fresh baked. The only flavor I could get out of it was "sweet". The rolled tacos were okay, they were filled with potato, which I knew before ordering, but there was just not enough flavor to them. Included in the take out bag was two small containers of sauce. The red one was very hot, but kind of tasteless and the green one was very mild and also tasteless. The tacos were crispy, but that is all I could really say for them. The rice had no flavor either, it really needed some spices and maybe some chopped green onions or something in it to make it flavorful. I don't know for sure, but I don't think the rice was very fresh either. The beans also were not flavorful, I was so disappointed! I tasted my husbands burrito (get your mind out of the gutter!!!), and it was the tastiest thing we ordered, but still not that great, it was filled with the same rice that was served on the side.   The worst part of this whole thing (PLEASE TAKE NOTE FOLKS WHO ORDER THEIR FOOD TO GO) is the boxes they put the food in are not at all sturdy. They put the boxes in a bag that is just big enough to fit. When I tried taking out the first big box, the contents ended up in the bag. I appreciate the fact that the boxes are good for the environment, but I wish they would have told me to just rip the bag open to get to the food. I highly advise doing that.   I really wish it would have been more to my liking, but I make some scrumptious vegan Mexican food at home, and maybe I'm just spoiled. I am glad that they have a presence in Las Vegas and I'm glad that so many people love the place. I'm all for cruelty free businesses and although it is not for me, I hope they do well.

-kIpdeJTbQRIy9IEJVmpXA.text: Panchos has really wonderful vegan Mexican food and burgers. The place is not at all fancy or even nice. Take out is a better option than eating in. Expect to wait awhile for your food. It gets busy and they don't have a huge wait staff.
