pE4vUw3-kthvDoJF96pfhA.text: The food is Vegan and cheap. The staff are all very nice people and  service is solid. Restrooms were clean and well stocked.  Some of the tacos were wet and soggy, dripping with extra liquid and not in a good way. Half the liquid and they would have been way better. So I had taco juice all down my elbow when I was done with this meal. I am so happy I wore short sleeves.   We tried 4 types of tacos.   We had chik-end made of soy. This was the best of the 4 we tried. Flavor was there and it tasted super good with hot sauce!  Mushrooms tacos were wet and soggy. I've had many good mushroom dishes and this one left me wanting much much more.   The Cactus was wet and soggy. I'm not sure if that is how cactus is supposed to be. I had never had cactus before.   Asada- the 2nd best honestly it was bad for seitan. Most seitan stuff is awful imo but the tacos were ok.  Hot sauce improved all of the tacos and they needed it.  As it stands I probably will not eat here again but if you're in the area and want something vegan it is not a terrible option.   They have a few hot sauce options on the table. Hot sauce is a must with this meal.

KOjVyIDvFIyl8ZG1UyTXpw.text: This place has delicious and authentic plant-based Mexican food at an outstanding price point. They have an extensive menu of classic Mexican items such as tacos, burritos, enchiladas, tortas, huaraches, nachos, etc., and everything on the menu is made from plant-based ingredients, with no animal products used in any of their recipes. This is a great option for vegans and also for meat eaters looking to reduce the amount of animal products they consume without sacrificing on flavor. It's a unique experience for vegans to be able to dine in such an authentic Mexican restaurant.   There are many different proteins to choose from, including vegan chorizo, vegan chicken, vegan asada, and vegan al pastor, amongst others. On Tuesdays, you can get 4 of these tacos for less than 5 dollars. During the rest of the week, a 4 taco special is still reasonably priced. The tacos are a step above any vegan-friendly taco you will get at any meat-based Mexican restaurant. The proteins are well-textured and taste good, but I think they could use a bit more seasoning personally. I wasn't fully able to tell the difference between the various flavors that I tried.   The enchiladas mole came on a huge plate with 3 enchiladas plus rice and beans. The mole sauce was excellent. It is rare to find vegan mole sauce, as it usually has chicken stock in it. I was a bit disappointed in the beans, as I love refried pinto beans, but they use whole pinto beans at this restaurant instead. So many Mexican restaurants cook their refried beans with animal products, so I was looking forward to having some authentic vegan refried beans.   I ordered ice cream for dessert, but unfortunately they said they were out of their homemade vegan ice cream for the day. Instead, I ordered the strawberry cake, and was disappointed to see a label on the cake that said "made on 11/15/2018." I was there on 11/20/2018, and it was not very appetizing to see that my sponge cake was made 5 days ago. As would be expected, the cake was tough and dry, and not very enjoyable except for the icing. I think they should have a better turn-around time than 5 days, especially since it was so busy inside when I went.   Panchos Vegan Tacos has a lot going for it, and I hope they continue to do well and expand their concept to other parts of the country. They were very busy the day I went there and seemed pretty stretched thin. As they adjust to their well-deserved popularity, I hope they also make sure to work out some of their inevitable kinks. I will definitely be coming back here any time I'm in the area.

x26NZgLdZASwv9irRIqYmw.text: I don't really like Vegas but I'm excited for another opportunity to eat at Panchos. They have an extensive menu - all vegan! - and solid food.  I ordered the mole enchiladas with "chicken" and my partner had a wet burrito with their chorizo (with both sauces) + a carnitas taco. Unfortunately, they were out of chicken so the cashier recommended the asada as a replacement. They were out of a few other things, including watermelon agua fresca, which was a real bummer for me but I guess I'll get over it eventually. We were there on a Monday around 3 or 4 in the afternoon, so found it a little strange they were out of so many things - poor preparation? unusually busy over the weekend? supply issues? Not sure. The guy who ordered after us also ordered something they were out of, and like us, was informed after he placed his order because the person who took it didn't know.  They also had some classic Mexican pastries (as well as other desserts). We didn't indulge but we're from Portland and I've never seen vegan conchas here so I thought that was pretty cool.  We had a couple hours of driving ahead of us so we got our food to go and didn't get an opportunity to eat it warm but it was still reaaaaally good. The only thing we didn't like was the mole sauce, which was too chocolatey and one note. The red sauce is super spicy. The salsa verde was pretty delectable with a nice tomatillo flavor. When I ate meat, I didn't like beef so I was hesitant on the asada but enjoyed it. Everything was well seasoned. My partner thought the carnitas was the best protein he tried, and would order that on the burrito next time.  The portions were generous (my partner couldn't finish his burrito, which was honestly the size of a large baby) and the prices were super cheap. In addition to our food, we both got a drink, and the total was less than $30 even before the "Meatless Monday" discount. Employees were friendly.   Overall, we look forward to coming back next time we're in Vegas.

hD7urcrgUcmX1d-wtOuC6Q.text: Bruuhhhh. If you want Mexican food without the runs afterwards this is your place!  They make these HUGE burritos. Omg. It was crazy. And it was so good! Very flavorful.  The tacos were also very good. Even the rice was tasty.   We ate like 1/3 and were stuffed. Ate the rest later for dinner. Lol, like you can actually buy one burrito and eat it for breakfast, lunch and dinner.   And the price was stellar for the size!  So happy we stopped here. Will definitely be back the next time we're in Vegas.

FsHH5_iB6wc96lOQU-7vbg.text: I had been told over and over by a coworker to check this place out so I finally decided to make it happen on my birthday. I'm SO GLAD I found this place!  FOOD: 10/10 recommend. The flavor is sooooo delicious and there is a huge variety of "meat." I ordered gluten-based asada and chorizo tacos, plus a mushroom taco. It was the Tuesday Special which got you either three or four tacos + a drink. The tacos came with some type of mild salsa, sliced cucumbers, sliced radishes and lots of lime wedges. I really can't get over the flavor. Each taco actually tasted unique but also True to its "real meat" counterpart. I like some hot sauce and tons of lime but even without that, the tacos are mouth watering on their own. As we were walking out, we saw a burrito and they do not skimp on that... It was huge! There are also so many options on the menu. I definitely wasn't expecting that. This is a great place if you want any type of Mexican food and... it's all 100% vegan.   COST: This is a crazy good place for healthy, tasty and affordable Mexican food! They have some sort of special for every day of the week- sopas, tacos, burritos, etc. but beyond this, the regular menu prices are around $6-$10 per meal.   ATMOSPHERE: It's not necessarily a good place for groups but it's great if you're hungry and want to stop somewhere for a quick (and healthy) bite to eat that isn't a drive thru. Very laidback and chill, definitely no need to get dressed up.

lJMHrABqzVv4cnS9GgHFSg.text: Delicious vegan Mexican food! I had always heard about this place from other students on campus and how good it is.  I finally went to try (3 times so far), even with my speculation of "vegan" Mexican food, and it did not disappoint! I've had the tacos and tostadas, which were both tasty.   My only minor con: I feel as if the flare and creativity that makes Mexican food is not all there. Maybe because of the vegan factor.  The tostadas I got were delicious however, they were a bit too overloaded, even for me; making the tostada itself difficult to pick up and went soggy too fast.   They have homemade green and red hot salsa and it's one of the best I've had! The red one is spicier than green one so watch out.   They have specials every day so just ask.   Their meat susbsitutions are great and tortillas  as well. Drinks are homemade and I love the horchata! Though beware, it sells out fast :/ Their cucumber lime water is refreshing and tasty, too.   I love the feeling of eating Mexican food without that heavy, bloated feeling you get after. So if you wanna try some delicious vegan Mexican food then come here.

9b6x0YzBnMwA2FV8Z_o7Jw.text: I am not vegan, but I really enjoy vegan food (especially because I am lactose-intolerant). This has got to be the best vegan Mexican joint here in town. According to one of the staff, everything on the menu is vegan, even if you see the words "cheese" and "sour cream."  I almost did not order the items I tried, but a customer in front of me assured me that everything is completely vegan.  Their Pozole tastes just like the real thing! It is a bit on the spicy side, but the texture of the vegan meat did not feel like the dish was meatless. The bowl was huge, so I had my fiance finish the rest.  I also got the grand taco, and though the sour cream looked like the real thing, my stomach did not react afterwards! I chose the chorizo vegan meat for this and the texture was just like ground meat.   I do wish the restaurant was much closer to the center of town, or that they had another location more on the West side, but it definitely is worth the drive for decent premium vegan food.

4N08HuxydReyzMAK1NSBAA.text: Was going weekly to Pancho's when it first opened it's doors on Pecos and Tropicana. Haven't been back since after the last incident. Every time we went in, I felt like the food changed and customer service got even worse. I remember ordering over the phone asking for the mole and whoever answered laughed and kept having to ask people around her for what I was talking about. I'm fair on a lot of things but that just was humiliating because it was clearly on the menu and she just didn't know since she was new. And my fiance and I both always ate at home and about an hour or so later, never failed to get stomach aches or some type of pain. I'm not here to tear down businesses, but to really bring light to management. Fresh products should be used with less processed items. Reason why I cook everyday no longer go out for food, can't trust anyone to make food when you yourself can make it and if anything make it better.

_8-OWxWs6D8rbrkgwZ3oCA.text: Thanks to Yelp, I found this gem in an offbeat place I would have never found otherwise. Food was soo flavorful and the owner/chef/server (yes that's one person) was very sweet and attentive. The set up of the restaurant is like a typical fast food joint, but food detailing and presentation is above par. They have 4 protein options: mushroom, cactus, gluten and soy based. I got a bunch of small plates as I wanted to taste everything. I had north Mexican sopes with cactus protein and absolutely loved it. Also tried burrito and a couple of tacos.

Po6wC-slFKuzNkW0QL1r0A.text: This is my go-to place when i'm craving tacos! I've been a vegetarian for years so it's pretty cool that their vegan tacos taste JUST LIKE REAL TACOS! I've taken several of my mexican friends here & they approve.  I didn't give them 5 stars because they tend to run out of a lot of things, like horchata, or certain things on the menu. They can also get really busy that it may take a long while for them to serve you/get your food. Despite that though, I still happily come back (:

Og3cYlj1ykTBDVM6KB9zKA.text: POSTMATES ORDER while in Vegas  Ordered the 3 soft tacos with vegan chicken meat & 3 red enchiladas with a different kind of vegan meat.   Can't remember what it was but it was spicy good.    I happen to gravitate towards organic & vegan restaurants so I thought I'd give it a try. RFm96-3Yw5yhbNWpmRBbJw.text: New location on Fort Apache is really-really nice: spacious, bright. We ordered Tamale and a Salad. BCjTdgQPRLxHJK_Ct44wHA.text: Today was mine and my boyfriend's first visit, and I was pleasantly surprised.  The cashier was rushed, because of orders,  but was still nice, the inside was very quaint, and I loved that they had choices with meat, because my boyfriend is a strict carnivore.  I'm only giving 4 stars, because the guacamole was to smooth, and someone got heavy with the lime on it, they didn't have diet soda, and my meal was good, but way to spicy, but other than that, I'd definitely recommend Pancho's Vegan Tacos,  because they show that Vegans eat more that salads,  and carrot sticks.

XMoDApBjSISlexEMV4VVLA.text: If you're going to be Vegan, this place is high on the list of best restaurants to eat in. Always good, great portions, tasty versions of all the Mexican food you love.

tK5z84ZLPcGaeoSlbyDgWw.text: Food there is really good! I've been there twice and so far I've tried Mole enchiladas, green salsa enchiladas and the Pozole. All three items are good but the Pozole, is awesome. This place is cheap compare to most vegan places!

Gp9MyNPu5NCiHpx_f2fCbg.text: Fast service. Their breakfast burritos were huge and super delicious. It looks like all their burritos are very large.

cKlpc5V4RU2RKPKmj9f0hg.text: Food is great, nothing spectacular but semi delicious. I stopped going here because the employees are completely rude. The lady Who is almost always there (older, glasses, shoulder length brown  hair) acts like she's on drugs or something. Ive probably ate here 10-15 times, and the ONE time I do end up complaining about my slimy cold cactus sandwich she accused me of trying to get free food as she twitched her head and body all weird while talking...."Well why didn't you come up and complain sooner? Where is your receipt?!" Ummm seriously? I ate not even a 1/3 of the sandwich, that's about how long it took for me to be entirely GROSSED out. She gave me my money back which was in her best interest. Also, the owner works the register a lot, he's impatient, antsy, and takes your order super speedy like you're taking up his time or something. These people are just always aggravated. sxEbopcnerVBCML31myRWg.text: Food is amazing. As a family we Ordered posole,  super fries, and green chili wet burrito all asada.  I was dancing in my sit the whole time I was eating.

kUtQCAcC6dYJKQZqBNm1tg.text: Greeted upon walking in, place was extra clean and the workers were very helpful in terms of the selections on the menu. I was craving enchiladas and couldn't decide green sauce or red but little did I know they did half and half! The posole!!! That was the highlight of my meal. I've been searching for really good posole without the meat, I've even tried to make my own several times. Their posole was flavorful and just exactly what I was looking for. If you're ever craving authentic Mexican food vegan style this is the place to go! Loved it!

2CcgveF98MdyDmkr3y7dbA.text: So my fiance and I tried a few things from their menu. Asada tacos- they were good wish the meat would be more crispy. But overall good.  Fried rolled potato taco- I really enjoyed this and loved how it had sour cream, vegan cheese, pico de gallo, and shredded lettuce. Would definitely get again.  Posole- coming from a authentic Mexican culture it was very bland. Here is why I didn't give them a 5 star. I was very disappointed.   Ham torta- very good! It wasn't just a plain torta. It had good flavor and fresh. I actually want to try the Cuban.   Service: very nice and helpful towards the menu.    Would I go again? Yes, try other things on the menu.

2u4woPV-4O_aoK3PghLylg.text: Went there yesterday by myself for a quick meal after work. I had the Chile Rellano because I've missed them since going Vegan. Omg the best I've had! They were amazing. I will definitely go back and tell everyone I know.

TEvCb7c3RaGJaYa_-NAKOg.text: Best vegan Mexican food in town hands down. The asada is soooo bomb. Service has really improved and majority of the staff is very friendly.

c6K0UQaPNeLFEMiaREA-DA.text: I ordered through Postmates... my goal was to attempt to become vegan. They're good was amazing! So far everything I had was great and the "meat" tastes like chicken! Will be ordering more often!

LSpRL9QdYFTw9zvoZsYZ3Q.text: The food was absolutely amazing! My partner and I shared 3 different plates. We got the taco combo (carnitas, asada, and chicken), our favorite of the three was the carnitas! I'm vegetarian and haven't ate a taco for 7 years and the tacos brought me back to my childhood, so delicious. The asada wet burrito was our second plate, we got it with both salsa's. The burrito is huge, great portion and great taste. Our last plate was the Cuban torta and omg this torta was just amazing. It had a crispy bread the vegan meat was out of this world. Loved the food and I loved the service!

zCLTc9yCxxaw52LKTs5i5g.text: Albondigas OMG!  Sooooo goood! Was like a party on my palate!  Every dish that my husband and I have had this place has been 100% amazing and satisfying. They exceed all expectations.   These vegan meals are tasty, filling, satisfying, and leave you excited to come back and have more.   The portions are great and sometimes have enough to take home. Everyone that works there is super nice.  I had the Albondigas during my most recent visit and it is probably one of the best meals I've ever had my life. Not sure how they get the flavor so exciting, but they have definitely conquered the art of culinary.

7VQAIMagcizf5tndBogzYA.text: Went in yesterday. Kind of disappointed. Food had the authentic feel of Mexican food. But the ceviche tostada tasted like just tomato sauce. The arroz con leche tasted like water and cinnamon nothing special. Their portions are huge so that's good. The place itself seems like it's going through renovation or something. I cook vegan food at home and it's not expensive to make, I feel like it's a bit overpriced.. it could be because I know how much it costs to make this type of food. The food wasn't out of this world delicious but it wasn't horrible. I feel like I should've just not been lazy and cooked at home.  Also the prices on their menus don't match what you pay for. They're more expensive by like .25. So keep an eye out for that, I noticed too late.

Q1EGuvilPGtEYUm2jNNVIA.text: I just discovered this place today, May 1, 2018. Can't believe I haven't been here before or heard of this place before now. It was a little difficult to find at first since my GPS led me to another place as sometimes it does. There's another vegetarian place across from where this restaurant is but I had a feeling it wasn't the one since it wasn't called Pancho's vegan tacos. Anyway, I found it and boy am I glad I did. The man at the register who I believe may be the owner, was very friendly and helpful. He asked me if it was my first time there and when I told him it was, he showed me how to order. Since today was Tuesday, he informed me that it was taco Tuesday and that I could get three tacos and a drink for $5.14 with tax. I was so excited about the price and I definitely was excited that I could get a cantaloupe drink included with my meal for that price or an extra taco. I look forward to trying many more of their menu items! In my opinion the food was tasty and filling. Maybe for the guys they should opt for the extra taco instead of the drink. I meant to ask about the ice cream that I saw advertised online that's coming. I'm not sure if they already have it or when they'll have it but I look forward to that and many more meals here.

anen0d4QHPU85yvDIpr1IQ.text: excellent authentic mexican food. amazing. i crave it everyday!!!!! ugh!  definitely the best thing in las vegas and probably best mexican place anywhere. not to mention vegan of course duh! there is large block lettering outside so you won't miss it!  we came here on our last day in vegas right when it opened at 10am and got the chilaquiles, red and green tamales, chickend and asada soft street tacos.   be prepared to drink lots of water (if you're basic like me) bc the chilaquiles are quite spicy but absolutely addictive! god i dream about that dish. the rice and beans they came with help to quell the spice. the rice was really good too.   loved both tacos, i think we liked the asada better. they are such a deal and typical tortilla size, so i would definitely get more than 2 if you're not getting anything else.   i'll pass on the tamales, they don't always have em, but compared to the other stuff-- they were dry and a bit bland. of course they came with a red and green salsa but my mouth was already on fire so i just couldn't anymore.   they were out of horchata but have a hibiscus tea drink and unsweetened (yay!) iced black tea.   god i love this place.  friendly owner & service. they've only opened about a year ago. your food gets served to you and they were kind enough to fill our water bottles.   we came on a friday morning so there were only about 2 others but one more came in.   casual, fast food like ambiance. looks like they're doing construction to expand their space.   petition to open one in la! please! i need pancho's!  if you live in la, it's worth it to drive a few hours and get pancho's. other good vegan spots around too. make it a vegan day trip!  ugh my mouth waters every time i think of this place. love that it's all vegan and mexican. yes!!!  don't forget to use the 10% check in! even though it's already cheap af. never enough deals.

LBa2dT6y8IBtU5mFGeq5Cw.text: Absolutely the worst vegan restaurant in Vegas. Have always had a problem every single time I order or visit this place. The staff sucks and food is kind of over priced. Tacotarian is the way to go for vegan Mexican food never again will I give this place my business

We went on Taco Tuesday and got the street tacos as well. They were so good! The sauces are very flavorful!   Awesome customer service, clean, and very relaxed setting. Great place to brings kids.

drEHlyGIjpZeU_5V8VLTUw.text: Their food is great. I'm giving it a 3-star because the service sucks. Today I walked in they were not very busy at all. There were a couple people in a booth eating and two parties waiting for their takeout order. After I ordered my food one of the people waiting came up and asked why it qas taking over 30 minutes and they still hadn't got their order. The lady with the grey short hair just looked at them like she was annoyed and said I don't know I put the ticket in. and then refunded their money telling them to keep the cake they had ordered. I guess that was the least she could do but her attitude stunk, there was no apology or explanation, and the people looked confused and disappointed. Furthermore another customer walked in and walked to the sale older lady to place an order but she was chit-chatting with another employee and yelled to the back for another girl to come out and take the order so she could continue her conversation- she legit said that out loud laughing. The girl that came out to help even looked a bit embarrassed as she took the customers order. That was just plain rude. My food also took a long time to come out and I only ordered fries and two tamales- which everyone knows tamales are pre-made you just have to wrap them in foil and throw them in the bag. Again the food is great (for fast food) but the lady at the front could seriously use some customer service training.

RykoIWlPlKLHmB1-EWc4SQ.text: My sister and I finally decided to try this place out and we will definitely be coming back! It's seriously so good and the food is seasoned well that if someone said it was vegan I wouldn't believe them! But the crazy part is that it is vegan! EVERYTHING! We ordered the -Chile relleno with carnitas -taco special with al pastor/carnitas  -Wednesday nacho special with carne  Presentation was displayed beautifully, so props to them for not only making it taste amazing but look amazing as well. W6SixsLEDDLGmPrHV8rDqg.text: We're not vegan but every so often we like to be more earth conscious and cut down on our meat consumption. We were near UNLV and decided to try this place out and it did not disappoint!  The food, I love spice and they know how to make a mean chorizo! It was incredibly spicy but my girlfriend and I absolutely loved it! We got it on the torta and wow were we amazed. If you put a meat chorizo torta and this one side by side and had me do a blind taste test.... I'd probably choose the vegan one. YES IT IS THAT GOOD! People working there are very kind make sure the food is up to par.   I got the breakfast burrito with "carne asada" For this one I cant say I didn't miss the actual meat because it did taste a bit odd, but its not meat so I wont complain, still had great flavor and I also got a side of the red sauce that I believe is on the chorizo and it made it amazing as well  Whether you're vegan or not come and try this place it wont disappoint!

OyKgP5lYcM93LQKfqMV2uw.text: I stopped by Pancho's for a quick to-go lunch to bring back to the office. Overall, I was pleased! I was greeted by the cashier as soon as I walked in.  Upon first impression, the menu was a lot larger than I expected. Judging by the name, I expected only tacos on the menu. I was pleasantly surprised to see a whole variety of Mexican food. I settled on the green enchiladas with "chicken" and a small order of the classic nachos. The cashier warned me that the green enchilada sauce is spicy, so I requested it be on the side instead of on top of the enchiladas. However, when I got my food, the sauce wasn't on the side. As she said, it was quite spicy. I still enjoyed them, but I would've preferred if the sauce was actually on the side. The nachos were tasty as well. I was surprised with how generous the small order was!  Overall, my favorite part of the meal was the "chicken." A lot of vegan meats have a weird taste or texture (or both), but this "chicken" was amazing! The taste was realistic and the texture wasn't rubbery or grainy. It was perfect.  I'm excited to return to Pancho's and try more of their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's Vegan Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic Nachos (without sour cream)
Photo of Pancho's Vegan Tacos - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

FfmoWPJgxOaFcMNfUvsm8g.text: 100% vegan, authentic Mexican food. The menu is extensive, with much more than just tacos. Burritos, sopes, tamales, enchiladas, tortas, etc and fresh aguas. Most of their mock meats are made in house, which is impressive considering the variety they offer. The restaurant is casual and minimally decorated, with plenty of seating. Orders are placed at the counter in front, and are then available for dine in or takeaway.  The Al Pastor was excellent, with complex chili flavors and a subtle pineapple sweetness. My boyfriend is not vegetarian and eats "real" Al Pastor often, and he loved these. The Chorizo also had a wonderfully meaty texture packed with spicy cayenne and achiote pepper heat. The Asada was gross. Bland and rubbery, with a wheat gluten aftertaste. The Carnitas had a nice pulled pork texture, but lacked flavor as well. The Nopales were overcooked and slimy.   We got Cheese Nachos to share, whose sauce was reminiscent of movie theater nachos, but with a milder flavor and a starchy consistency. The Jamaica was watery and not sweet enough.  While these are not the best vegan tacos I have ever had, I appreciate that you can get a substantial plant based meal for under $10, without venturing too far from the strip.

T6sno452ah30xkIw31eKbg.text: Um. Pardon my language but holy shit, this place is a fantastic piece of vegan food right in the heart of Vegas.   I wish I had ordered more street tacos but I was so thrilled I could essentially order vegan carne asada fries. On their menu, they're called Supreme fries and you can add any of the vegan proteins tomo your order. I chose the "asada." I also got an "al pastor" street taco.   The fries are very shareable... there's a small order option as well. It's loaded with vegan protein, nacho cheese, sour cream, avocado and pico de gallo. I would have wanted bigger chunks asada "meat" but it was super tender and seasoned beautifully.   The street taco was delightful. The al pastor "meat" reminded me of adobada meat. Super flavorful and tender. Paired with the salsa verde, it is a perfect taco!  My sister in law got the albonigas served up with rice, beans and tortillas. I tasted with albonigas "meat"balls and my oh my! The "meat" melts in your mouth and the chipotle sauce it is drenched in has quite the kick of spice and flavor!  Ugh. I need more! When am I going back to Vegas? Hopefully soon!

South Fish Tacos Asada Nachos Grand Taco  Mom ordered Chile Relleno and a Quesadilla  It's a lot of food and you're not missing out on anything. Except, maybe heat. My food wasn't hot. Warm but not hot.   That's my only complaint.  The food is really good and flavorful!  Even the non vegans thought this place was good!

rSCxIcwsHotEW0x3uLexAQ.text: I loved this place! Even though their name says tacos, they have all kinds of Mexican food: enchiladas, chilaquilas, burritos, tamales, and much more. The menu is quite extensive. They even have Impossible Burgers!   I had a taco plate - 3 street tacos, beans and rice - and a big glass of jamaica... and it was more food than I could eat. I ordered 3 different kinds of tacos: al pastor, chicken, and asada, all made with house-made vegan protein. My omnivore cousin ordered a chicken burrito bowl and she really liked it; I'm pretty sure this was her first vegan food experience so I'm glad we went here because it made a good impression on her. Her burrito bowl was too big for her to finish as well!  The food is tasty, portions are generous, hot sauce is perfectly spicy-hot (always a good thing as far as I'm concerned), the jamaica is excellent, the chips, guacamole, and bean dip very good, and the service was great with very friendly staff. I'm definitely going back here to eat again and would recommend it to anyone wanting good vegan Mexican food, or even a vegan cheeseburger.

I would definitely come back and revisit these amazing sopes.

Ly-qRPNxjt5zZOqKAVh2AA.text: My co-worker had been raving about this place for months. Unfortunately, I live in Aliante, and they were located on the other side of town. Imagine how happy I was to see their food truck parked outside of the Natural Grocers store right in MY neighborhood! They said they were going to be there every weekend (except for First Fridays)!  I had the 3 street tacos, and I tried 1 of each flavor. OMG SO AMAZING!!!  The flavor is so authentic, you forget that it's 100% vegan! I became a vegan about 8 months ago, and I have had so much fun discovering all kinds of incredible, healthy food. Pancho's is hands down my favorite when it comes to Mexican food. I will be stopping by their food truck EVERY weekend!!!  Thanks so much for coming to my side of town!

8MUywC1tJ59wjrqQnCPh9Q.text: I have always loved Mexican food but the downside is that I feel terrible after I eat it.   Something about chips and salsa before, and then meat, cheese, lots of fried tortillas, heavy sauces, rice and beans (and maybe tequila) hits me pretty hard physically and after a meal I have to recover.  It's like my systems have to shut down to process all the carbs, grease, and meat.    This restaurant has delicious, wonderful food, and after you eat it you still feel really good.    I have always mistrusted the traditional ceviche, where the cooks claim that the fish is "cooked" by the citrus that is added.  That does nothing to kill the microbes that are in the fish.  Panchos has provided an excellent ceviche that I don't have to be scared to eat because it's plant based.    The potato tacos are so good.  I still have a lot of things I want to try on the menu.

5RZ_ycGVBgGD9Aj0NvMctg.text: Yeah, the food is alright. It's honestly nothing to rave about. The food is cheap, the service is decent, location is mediocre. I wouldn't suggest it to anyone enthusiastically but I might mention as a means to get access to fast/cheap/easy food. Ordering on Grubhub or any online platform can be of frustration because it's not uncommon for them to get the orders mixed up or to leave some things out. For example last time I ordered a combo and I only received the main item, without the sides. Now that's of annoyance. I personally haven't tried all of their items, but like I said it's average food. Something you can easily whip up at home. The rice is probably one of the worst things that they serve, it's mushy and bland. The pinto beans are also a joke. They lack love and flavor. The mole enchiladas, potato tacos, street tacos, and tamales are great though. If they enhanced certain items, they would most likely be able to drive in more clientele and I wouldn't hesitate stopping in more frequently myself.

rj12dxk1q-cRpMn9kAmbug.text: First off it's always nice to see places that cater to us vegetarian/vegan eaters. Great customer service, always made sure we were taken care of. DEKUjGYEuxg2wzEiVvFWwQ.text: Wow, just wow. As a lifelong Mexican food eater from San Diego and full-blown anti-veg carnivore up until a few years ago, I can say that this place delivers like no other. It is real Mexican food--spot-on "meats" and sauces and sour cream--but 100% plants. The location, ambience, menu, and service is authentic hidden gem, strip-mall Mexican food, yet, dare I say it again, made from plants.  I sampled the potato rolled tacos (crispy and satisfying--I could have eaten 5), "cheese" and jalapeno tamale (very good without being dry), the "beef" tamale (also good, though I think I liked the jalapeno better because I like the little kick), and the wet burrito with both the red and green sauces (HUGE burrito with crumbled beef that is so "real," you'll be truly concerned that a mistake was made). I liked the green sauce a little more, but both sauces were perfect and I asked for another serving. I would legitimately buy those sauces and put them on everything.  My man sampled my plates and also had the "chicken" burrito--loved it all, couldn't believe the serving sizes, loved the sauces, and walked out stunned that we got our "dirty Mexican food" vegan style. "How did they make the rice vegan!? What sour cream is that!? Can you believe the menu!? Can we go back tomorrow!? That wasn't greasy and I don't feel gross--how is this happening!?" He's an Alberto's (Filibertos, etc.) guy and felt like, for the first time in around 6 years, that he got "his food" without compromising a thing. The boy was practically dancing in the streets.   No way that anyone will think the food is vegan--everyone will like it. Flavorful, filling, messy, crunchy, saucy, awesome Mexican food without consuming/harming/using an animal. Just wow.

3eF3puPiyATUOBcvFoXYKA.text: Ridiculous good  Came to vegas for weekend and we ate here twice its THAT GOOD!!  Pastor was oooooooooweeeeeeeee! Delicious Torta its like being in mexico can say anything Bad. Actually the only thing i dont like is that there not in  los angeles

h5TbmCCiQo-CtKezC0nqEA.text: Yelper beware! Once you eat at Pancho's tacos you will totally rethink this whole "vegan food is disgusting thing!" These have to be BTC is tacos let alone vegan tacos hands-down!  Let's be real! I would never order Vegan tacos on my own. But I have an employee who is vegan and offered me a street taco from a "yummy Mexican vegan place!" I was starving so I did not deny her offer! She made an order off of Grubhub and 45 minutes later heaven came to our work in the form of a street taco! The aroma alone was satisfying! We unwrapped the little package of goodness and it blew my mind! Not only did these street tacos look like real chorizo tacos, but the smelt Devine!!   Slowly I bit into perfection! Immediately I was hooked. The trees are actually tasted like chorizo and the red salsa made it a little bit spicy and warm when chewing! It was the perfect combination of textures and flavors. I literally wasn't expecting a flavor explosion in my mouth. I then literally devoured all for street tacos without sharing with her! Oops! I really didn't feel bad. Since that Vegan taco relationship defining moment Pancho's Vegan Tacos and I have been going steady for about 1 month!!!   I've tried the tacquitos, street tacos, beans, rice, horchata, and carne Asada fries! All perfection!! It's a must try!!

I definitely recommend trying the chicken over the asada. If you're searching for that chared taste the chicken seems to have it more then the asada. I also recommend the sopes as that was what everyone in my family favored over their own choices that they had made. The beverage selection is rather limited. The food tasted ok, not the best but the amount was defiantly more than filling.

17mSWDIniyKdXq6o8n2N2w.text: UPDATE 3/9/18: this is by no means anything against the food, the food here is pretty good. The customer service from this company specially today was very poor! I was informed they were on dirty dining and because I made a comment on one of their Facebook post they felt the need to send me a private message being extremely defensive. After I readdressed this via their public post they continued to argue with me through their social media account. I just don't think that's something you do to a customer.... specially when the vegan community here in Las Vegas is very tight-knit.... not sure on how I feel about this, it's tough when you enjoy the food of a place but the service is not up to par.....  So I was surprised to see that a place would actually have authentic vegan tacos. The location of this place was a bit confusing but it's located by the Tropicana Cinema. The prices are very affordable there's a lot of choices with drink combos too. I stuck to the single authentic style tacos these are made out of seitan. I used to be a meat eater and tacos were some of three foods I missed the more THESE TACOS ARE SOOO GOOD you cannot tell the difference from real meat. My favorite would have to be the "chorizo" and the "alpastor". I also had he orchata but this was regular not too sweet. Definitely recommend this place it is very good!

ORABVVidY00VgBxjNE_AWA.text: This place really has my heart. I remember the first time going here which was about a year ago now and i was very skeptical at the time of whether vegan Mexican food would fulfill the same cravings I have for regular Mexican food. Needless to say, I was hooked from the beginning. The food is amazing! I try to come here almost every week now because of how committed I am to this place. I've watched it grow so much as well and their renovations are such a nice touch to the overall feeling. My usual order is Supreme fries, but you really can't go wrong with anything on their menu. They've even recently released Vegan ice cream that I still need to try! Pancho's Vegan Tacos is definitely a place you want to visit.

vWohf-ke0xrB4FG3RCLjvA.text: This review is for the location on Pecos. I want to like them so bad. I've tried repeatedly for almost two years. I want nothing more than to throw my money at them and support a vegan business. But the food has been consistently horrible 100% of the time. Cmon guys it's not hard to put a bit of effort and season your food. The nacho cheese is a joke. Throw a bit of chipotle powder on it and bam! It no longer tastes like bland yellow water. The fries... they shouldn't be see-through! Just leave those suckers in the fryer for a bit longer and you'll notice magic happen. And the tamales... any Hispanic person knows to reheat tamales by steaming them. Your team should be embarrassed for nuking tamales and giving them to customers. I don't even want to start on the soaking soggy bland tacos. As a vegan Hispanic, this is so disappointing. Take some pride in your product and put some flavor and effort! I'll never go back, but I hope you guys get your sh*t together and succeed.

hDBBGumGYoxvJFuQzTuklg.text: Unpolished  One of a kind is definitely fitting for this pretty frig-gggin delicious authentic vegan restaurant. I ordered the "Tuesday" special three asada tacos, three fried rolled potato tacos, and two tamales for approximately $15.00. With the exception of the tamales everything else is totally worth returning for! The seasoning was on point, and each dish taste uniquely different as it should (unlike some of the other competitors). The presentation of my to-go order was simple yet impressive. It was refreshing not to see any oil or grease in my containers.   Useful Tip: Utilize the menu before ordering at the counter.   The cashier was pretty intimidating he just stood their asking is that it repetitively. If your seeking an vibrant, down to earth vibe from management this might not be your place aside from that the food is terrific and 100 percent worth returning for!!

_SYS6-x0nzk06TnJyNPFCQ.text: OK,  So I was checking this place out for the daughter as she is a Vegan and this is near my office.  I finally came here for lunch!  1. Location - You are gonna have a hard time finding this as it is tucked into a strip mall that is somewhat discombobulated in terms of access and all the different stores.  This is the location where there is a Dunkin Donut, 7/11 and a Tropicana Theater that has older released movies for cheap.  If you go at lunch, it can be hard to park.  2. The Restaurant - Interesting Decor, built for efficiency more than modernism.  Not a negative, and really it is just okay, but boy is it very efficient.  Order food, sit and wait and you can see them processing the food or you can dine in on the dining room side that has a few tables . The restaurant was quite busy during lunch.  3. The food - Yes, I love mushrooms so I had a classic  burrito with mushrooms.  It was so good and I love the two sauces that they give you. I used them both.  The rice, beans are perfect and with the mushrooms, you cannot beat the taste.  I was about to order another one for dinner it was so good.  They offer four choices of vegan meat, a gluten based Asasa/Al Pastor / Chorizo, Mushrooms, Soy based meat or cactus.  I haven't tried the cactus yet, but if it is like a jack fruit, that should be good.   Next on my list will be Soft Street Tacos, Tomales and I cannot wait to try the Posole.  I am glad I will be going back to this place.   GK says check it out.

HhnKB0caSDlIRcb1MlhDtg.text: My first visit here. The chik-end tacos were very good. Hubby got the chorizo burrito  it was huge and he thought it was pretty good. Service was just okay.  We dined in... comfy but you must know this is a small restaurant in an older part of town. It's somewhat refreshing for me personally... reminds me of my small hometown family owned businesses/restaurants... shout to the east coast. The real disappointment was the "guacamole" and chips. Really only avocado smashed up a little with a small hint of lime. Definitely would never order that again.

3CqiX8h1FiX85duBm6N5YQ.text: This place has been my go-to spot for awhile. I hate to leave anything less than 5 star, but this place has gone downhill. It's ridiculous how bad they are at messing orders up now, nearly every single time. What happened to the rice/beans? It's not worth ordering anymore. The quality of their food has been dropping off. yTz8XSWqprQZRF8nUBSiEQ.text: This place is such a gem. I'm writing this in hopes more people see this place.  This place is simple and to the point. No fancy decor needed. No fancy tables. Just normal dining because their food speaks for itself. Everything on their menu is 100% vegan down to the cheese. Every dish down to burritos is under $10. Vegan food can be expensive from time to time but not here.  I came in on taco Tuesday to find that 3 tacos and a drink is $4.25. How is that possible. It's like the best deal in town. I ordered a round wii my buddy and ended up getting up to order another round.  The owner it looked like, was very gracious when I complimented the food.   If you want a awesome taco Tuesday deal, or great vegan Mexican food please come to panchos. I promise you'll love it. Did I mention my buddy isn't vegan and asked to go back next Tuesday ;)

VWFhy_i_KG5ABJ2H3APasQ.text: Went in for first time, everything was amazing.  We ordered a ton of food and were so happy with everything.  I had the al pastor torta and carne Asada taco, ALL VEGAN. Went back next day to entertain some family, and the food just seemed disappointing... it's incredibly incredibly Bland, no seasoning, no depth, as a chef by profession these are things I look for.. when you ask for salt they give you little tiny packets and to season your food properly you're gonna need at least 8... all growing pain issues that can be fixed to make the place successful. 44hbHpv65UfWoKrXgba2rQ.text: I was very impressed to see a full vegan menu, but had to buy a little of everything to see if it was quality. I got the Tofu Scramble Burrito, Chick-end Sopes, Cheese Chili Rellenos, Al Pastor Posole, & the 3 Enchiladas (Nopales, Asada, Chick-end) with rice & beans. Everything was well seasoned & they use Follow Your Heart cheese so the creamy melted Relleno was delicious. Their sauces are so good, especially the reddish orange one which has the perfect amount of spicy. The breakfast burrito was my favorite, well flavored, lots of avocado & a quality tortilla... there wasn't anything that I didn't like. The posole broth was delicious & perfect for the congestion I had going on. I'm looking forward to going back. It's a very friendly place with amazing customer service.

3eCXkPUL725RZIwOBUxdAw.text: "Updating" as a reply for the owner.   Firstly: I never said nor stated I am strictly vegan. NOT being vegan however, doesn't diminish nor make my inquiries any less valid. My personal dietary restrictions don't take away my concerns for what is in your food that I am PAYING for and putting in my body. I'm flattered you dug through my other reviews though.   Secondly: How are you going to dispute ME on what YOUR employee SAID TO ME - To go and visit the taco shop around there. Because yes, he also is NOT vegan (like I told him I wasn't!)and eats at the taco shop when he doesn't want to eat where he works. Obviously you weren't there because if you were I would have received all this information on the spot. Which leads us to  My third point: I appreciate you giving us information about the food (now). The problem you STILL FAIL to realize AND address, is that NOWHERE on your website, or menus can we have the knowledge of (and verify) ingredients and the sources. You said it yourself!! All those other places are frozen , pre-made etc. So we're suppose to just now take your word on the basis that you "exposed" other establishments? That's what I meant when I said you have a responsibility as a VEGAN establishment to provide this information TRANSPARENTLY and have it READILY available to support your claim. It's nowhere to be found. If you don't understand what I am asking for with "What are your ingredients for your all your vegan protein?" I cant help you. That is as clear as I can make it. This IS about Panchos, not any other place.   Fourth: To be fair here. I read a couple of reviews BEFORE writing mine because I said to myself  "Am I? Am I the only one who thinks this way?" And no! I am not alone. Read some four star reviews, even five star reviews and you'll see where I get what I am saying in my review. Your customer base (not all) says your establishment is out of items constantly, the drink selection is minuscule to bare minimum and I got the "hole in the wall" reference from another two reviews. I was not the first one. So maybe even if reviews give you four or five stars, you should read them. Or don't. It's your business.   Lastly: This is very audacious of you.   "Simply for the fact that we are 100% vegan, non-gmo and low sodium... your life just got healthier."  Why cause  low sodium? Just because you believe that less sodium is good for you shows me how uninformed you personally really are. The scientific community has never come to consensus  that less sodium is best for everyone. Low sodium IS better when you've overloaded your system with it or if you have an intolerance to it. I am not in need of low sodium or non-gmo. I am in need of less calories. Which is what most of your dishes are NOT. Based on what I was served (NOT HOW MUCH I ATE) alone, it contained all my calories for one 24 hour period... a detriment to MY diet. Why would you think eating out at your establishment is making MY life healthier? How do you know I'm not having a cheat meal at your restaurant? Healthy = is a dish with protein equivalent to fats and carbs OR high volume (A LOT OF FOOD) but low fat/low carb. Again, something the dishes served here aren't.   'When people say that Pancho's Vegan Tacos is a "fast food" place.. makes me wonder.'   Wonder no more. I just answered it for you.  If I ate here everyday I would become morbidly obese. It doesnt fit the healthy profile based on the proportions of carbs/protein or volume/carbs to MAINTAIN a healthy lifestyle. Personally, I maintain a strict diet so that I can eat out often. Unfortunately, I cant do that here.  I will check out your new location once it opens and the old one closes, maybe you'll have the nutrition facts and I will surely update my review then.

FRqyuaXnEt4Bqfw8n64BFg.text: Newly vegan(2weeks) and everyday I'm learning/discovering new things to eat and places to try. Seen this place on Instagram and was really excited to try. It was a bit hard to find, it's tucked behind some other places in a strip mall. Really lowkey. Cashier seemed a bit impatient and not as friendly as I hoped. However, the food was GREAT and I enjoyed it.

K3yUrmGmBFkgepjBrJd6xA.text: As a Laco-Ovo Vegetarian, Vegan restaurants are a place where I can find a range of (hopefully well) thought-out entrees and sides instead of picking from one or two token dishes without meat or subbing something for something, hold the other thing. Most often, Vegan restaurant management is tuned into common food issues such as Gluten and Soy allergies and avoiding the GMO tell-tale High Fructose Corn Syrup by using Cane Sugar.   This is not the case with Panchos. They have no Gluten Free options nor do they have any Meat Substitutes that are not Soy-based. If you are seeking Gluten-free or Soy-free, you will not find it at Panchos as of late May 2017.  While this may be no huge deal, there is a deal breaker for me. Panchos Vegan Tacos, a "MEXICAN RESTAURANT FOR VEGANS," DOES NOT OFFER GUACAMOLE. SRLSY. Yes, you read that correctly, a Vegan Taco Shop that does not offer Guacamole. Isn't this like reverse cultural appropriation or something, the withholding of the best part of their culture?  Now, if you had Panchos Carnivorous Currascaria maybe you could get away with it, because maybe Brazilians don't appreciate guac for the elixir of life that it is. But a taco shop without guac is like an airplane without  wings, a politician without lies, or a Filipino doctor on United Airlines, it just doesn't fly.  I see a new ad with a tostada that appears to have green goodness on it. Or at least it appears green, so maybe they took the feedback to heart and adjusted with the market, and if that becomes the case before I find out and update this review, then good on 'em for evolving their business. I intend to stop by in a few months when I'm out and about and hungry and have cash to eat out and see. 'Cause if there's guac I'll stay and eat the Soy and Gluten, nom nom, for I'm just a Laco-Ovo Vegetarian looking for a yummy Taco that has Guac!

0HPJ8vmPy-mHsJ68x72d2w.text: I've been seeing so much talk about this place so I finally went on cinco de mayo. A3vqRu7UgGTiQ0Xe_Emw_g.text: I absolutely love this place.  I live in LA, but the last 3 times I have been to Vegas, we have stopped at Pancho's.  The service is fast and friendly.  The menu is amazing.  One of the best Mexican Vegan places that I have been to.  There is something on the menu for everyone.  The have a great choice of "meats".  Their version of carne asada was delicious.  The salsas are amazing.  The service is fast and friendly.  I've tried the pozole, burritos, tacos, sope and tostadas on my various visits.  I have not been disappointed once.  I don't always eat soy meats, so this place is a nice treat to my usual vegan diet.  I am glad to have found this spot and will continue to visit whenever I am in Las Vegas.

aiQ2M9hyrk7CL8deji4O0g.text: I've already eaten here three times and I'm finally reviewing. What can I say, the food is impeccable full of flavor and so much to choose from on their menu. I've had the burrito plate as well as the street tacos and their horchata. As someone who has been plant based diet for a year it's great knowing there's restaurants like Pancho's where you can still get the food you know and love. The entire establishment is very clean and bathrooms are very well kept. Can't wait to try the vegan ice cream they're adding to the menu and on the weekend they serve vegan donuts from a local vegan donut place. Look forward to coming back and trying more delicious food.

3sDCAY7cFPZCti3exNV5sA.text: I first tried Pancho's after numerous co-workers swore up and down about how delicious this vegan food is. As I just recently started cutting meat/animal products out of my diet i figured I'd give Pancho's a try. I ordered an Asada burrito to go. Holy smokes!  The burritos are not only huge but tasty as well. I ended up having 1/2 for lunch and finished the other 1/2 for dinner.  My next visit I ordered the dorrados (potato tacos) with rice and beans. Everything was seasoned and full of flavor. Definitely a yummy choice. My subsequent visits resulted in orders of Pastor nachos with nacho cheese instead of shredded, and asada street tacos. Everything I've ordered has been delicious and I definitely don't feel like I'm missing out on not having meat.  Since the recent expansion and addition of a second register, ordering to go has been so easy. In fact maybe too easy as I've been to Pancho's 7? times in the last month and a half and today was recognized by the guy who normally runs the register.  I think I've become a regular...lol. It's conveniently located down the street from my workplace and so easy to pick up lunch when I've forgotten to bring mine from home.
